superobruo: <entryFree id="n46826" type="main" key="su^pe^robru^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕr-obrŭo</orth> (usually separate, <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭ-per obrŭo</orth>), <itype>ŭi, ŭtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46826.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cover over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overwhelm</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">Tarpeiam ingestis armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 4, 91: <cit><quote lang="la">Hecubam injectis saxis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epit. 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
superobrutus: <entryFree id="n46827" type="main" key="su^pe^robru^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕrobrŭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of superobruo.</entryFree>
superobumbro: <entryFree id="n46828" type="main" key="su^pe^ro^bumbro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕr-ŏbumbro</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46828.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to overshadow</hi> (late Lat.), Mar. Merc. Cyrill. Incarn. Unigen. 14.</sense></entryFree>
superoccidens: <entryFree id="n46829" type="hapax" key="su^pe^rocci^dens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕr-occĭdens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [occido], <sense id="n46829.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">setting just after</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">luna soli antecedenti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 18 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
superoperio: <entryFree id="n46830" type="main" key="su^pe^ro^pe^ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕr-ŏpĕrĭo</orth>, <itype>īre, 4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46830.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cover over</hi> (late Lat.), S. S. Psa. 105, 17, ap. Aug. ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
superordinatio: <entryFree id="n46831" type="main" key="su^pe^rordi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕr-ordĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n46831.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the choice of a bishop</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s successor</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 12, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
superordino: <entryFree id="n46832" type="main" key="su^pe^rordi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕr-ordĭno</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46832.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to appoint in addition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to add something to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,009:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gal. 3, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
superparticularis: <entryFree id="n46833" type="main" key="su^perparti^cu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-partĭcŭlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: <sense id="n46833.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">numerus,</quote> <trans><tr>containing a number and an aliquot part of it besides</tr>, <tr>superparticular</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, § 761</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
superpartiens: <entryFree id="n46834" type="main" key="su^perparti^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-partĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [partio]: <sense id="n46834.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">numerus,</quote> <trans><tr>containing a number and several aliquot parts of it besides</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, § 762</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
superpendens: <entryFree id="n46835" type="hapax" key="su^perpendens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-pendens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [pendeo], <sense id="n46835.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">overhanging</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:27:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 27, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
superperspicio: <entryFree id="n46836" type="main" key="su^pe^rperspi^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕr-perspĭcĭo</orth>, <itype>cĕre, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46836.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to look away over</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
superpeto: <entryFree id="n46837" type="main" key="su^perpe^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-pĕto</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46837.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to ask further</hi> (late Lat.), Ven. Fort. Vit. Leob. 6.</sense></entryFree>
superpictus: <entryFree id="n46838" type="main" key="su^perpictus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭperpictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of superpingo.</entryFree>
superpingo: <entryFree id="n46839" type="main" key="su^perpingo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-pingo</orth>, no <sense id="n46839.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>pictus, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to paint above</hi> or <hi rend="ital">over</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 906</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
superplaudo: <entryFree id="n46840" type="hapax" key="su^perplaudo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-plaudo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46840.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to clap</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flap over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">at</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">pinnulis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
superpolluo: <entryFree id="n46841" type="hapax" key="su^perpollu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-pollŭo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46841.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cover with pollution</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem terram (iniquitas),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Esd. 4, 15, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
superpondium: <entryFree id="n46842" type="hapax" key="su^perpondi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭperpondĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>super-pondus</etym>, <sense id="n46842.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an overweight</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 196, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
superpono: <entryFree id="n46843" type="main" key="su^perpo_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-pōno</orth>, <itype>pŏsŭi, pŏsĭtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46843.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to put</hi> or <hi rend="ital">place over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to set up</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n46843.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46843.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">superpositum capiti decus (i. e. pileus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altissimam turrim congestis pilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuam marmoream Jano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">villam profluenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:5:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 5, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">villa colli superposita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut omnis materia jugo superponatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:25:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 25, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis, quae uno jugo superponatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:5:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aegra superpositā membra fovere manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:21:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 21, 190</bibl></cit>: desertis Africae duas Aethiopias superponunt, <hi rend="ital">place above</hi> or <hi rend="ital">beyond</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 8, 8, § 43</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Galatia superposita,</quote> <trans><tr>situated above</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 32, 42, § 146</bibl></cit>: hominis collo superpositum, Capitol. Max. et Balb. 9; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 27</bibl>.— With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">arx asperi montis interruptā planitie superposita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 2, 12</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46843.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., medic. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to lay on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apply</hi> a plaster or the like, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 38, § 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:75" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 7, 24, § 75</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">emplastrum loco dolenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 206" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 206</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46843.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to place over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">above.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46843.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To place</hi> or <hi rend="ital">set over</hi>, of official station, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Perperna in maritimam regionem superpositus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Fragm. Libr. 91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Fragm. Libr. 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut unus de presbyteris superponeretur ceteris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Ep. ad Tit. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer super hoc positus officium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">T. FLAVIO SVPERPOSITO MEDICORVM,</quote> <trans><tr>president</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 581, 7</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n46843.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To place before</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prefer</hi>: Stoici volunt superponere <pb n="1809" /> <cb n="SUPE" /> huic etiam aliud genus magis principale, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 58:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 58, 13</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n46843.7" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To place after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">postpone</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(ante gesta) levioribus superponenda sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summum est enim ... huic deinde aliquid superpositum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 4, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:10:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 10, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
superpositio: <entryFree id="n46844" type="main" key="su^perpo^si^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭperpŏsĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>superpono</etym>, <sense id="n46844.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a paroxysm</hi> in disease, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:13:179 al" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 13, 179 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
superpositus: <entryFree id="n46845" type="main" key="su^perpo^si^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭperpŏsĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of superpono.</entryFree>
superpostulatio: <entryFree id="n46846" type="main" key="su^perpostu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-postŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n46846.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an additional demand</hi>, Cod. Th. 7, 4, 28.</sense></entryFree>
superquartus: <entryFree id="n46847" type="main" key="su^perquartus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-quartus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>; of a number, <sense id="n46847.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one fourth as much more</hi> (i. e. that bears to another the ratio of 5 to 4): <cit><quote lang="la">numerus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, § 761 sq.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
superquatio: <entryFree id="n46848" type="main" key="su^perqua^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-quătĭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46848.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to shake above</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">over and above</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 1205</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
superquintus: <entryFree id="n46849" type="main" key="su^perquintus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-quintus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>; of a number, <sense id="n46849.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one fifth as much more</hi> (i. e. which bears to another the ratio of 6 to 5): numerus, Boëth. Arithm. 1, 24; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, § 761 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
superrasus: <entryFree id="n46850" type="main" key="su^perra_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-rāsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [rado], <sense id="n46850.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">scraped over</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clavi pedum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 23, 49, § 104</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
superrimus: <entryFree id="n46851" type="main" key="su^perri^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭperrĭmus</orth>, v. superus, III. A.</entryFree>
superruo: <entryFree id="n46852" type="main" key="su^perru^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-rŭo</orth>, <itype>ere</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n46852.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fall</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rush upon; act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Socratem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 109, 31</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpori,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 126</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 12, 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
supersapio: <entryFree id="n46853" type="hapax" key="su^persa^pi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-săpĭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46853.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to possess very good taste</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
superscando: <entryFree id="n46854" type="main" key="su^perscando"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-scando</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sŭperscendo</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46854.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to climb</hi> or <hi rend="ital">step over</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not anteAug.): somno strata corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:36:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 36, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi prostrato superscenditur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Poen. 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
superscendo: <entryFree id="n46855" type="main" key="su^perscendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭperscendo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n46855.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the preced.</ref></xr> art.</sense></entryFree>
superscribo: <entryFree id="n46856" type="main" key="su^perscri_bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-scrībo</orth>, <itype>psi, ptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46856.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to write upon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to superscribe</hi> (postAug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:4:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:10:4" default="NO">50, 10, 4</bibl>; Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:123" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 123</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46856.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to write over</hi> as a correction, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:52" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 52 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:6:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 6, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
superscriptio: <entryFree id="n46857" type="main" key="su^perscripti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭperscriptĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>superscribo</etym>, <sense id="n46857.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inscription</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superscription</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:22:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 22, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:23:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Luc. 23, 38</bibl>; Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:34" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 34</bibl>; Hilar. in Psa. 63, 1.</sense></entryFree>
supersedeo: <entryFree id="n46858" type="main" key="su^perse^de^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-sĕdĕo</orth>, <itype>sēdi, sessum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n46858.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sit upon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">above.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46858.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic. or Cæs.): eques Romanus elephanto supersedens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tentorio (aquila),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corio (damnati),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 25, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ansam (aspis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 262, 29</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n46858.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> * </sense><sense id="n46858.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To preside over</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vilicus litibus familiae supersedeat,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>decide them</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 5, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46858.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be above</hi> or <hi rend="ital">superior to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to forbear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to refrain</hi> or <hi rend="ital">desist from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">omit</hi> (the predom. and class. signif.); constr. usu. with <case>abl.</case>, less freq. with <case>dat.</case>, <case>acc.</case>, or <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46858.5" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita censeo facias, ut supersedeas hoc labore itineris, Cic Fam. 4, 2, 4: proelio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istis rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istis verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: nuptiis, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 40, 8</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 163 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">commode principio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 9, 17</bibl></cit> et saep.— <hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">posse complexione supersederi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:40:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 40, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supersederi litibus et jurgiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:51:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 51, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divinis rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tributo ac delectu supersessum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:27:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 27, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod cum acciderit, omnino oratione supersedendum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:21:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 21, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supersedendum multitudine verborum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 20, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">complexione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 19, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46858.6" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnae, Auct. B. Afr. 75, 2: maledicto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 285, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46858.7" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">operam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:29:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 29, 13</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec causa non visa est supersedenda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 17, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istis omnibus supersessis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 359, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46858.8" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: de virtute eorum accusanda proloqui supersederunt, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 40, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">supersedissem loqui apud vos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:40:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 40, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 7, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:59:2" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 59, 2</bibl>: quae in vulgus edita ejus verbis invertere supersedeo, Tac A. 15, 63 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castigare territos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:6:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectare supersedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deflectere ad visendum Apin supersedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut venire supersedeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:8:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 8, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
supersellium: <entryFree id="n46859" type="main" key="su^perselli^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpersellĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n46859.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shabrack</hi>: quod sellam tegebat, Vita <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> 2, 2, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
superseminator: <entryFree id="n46860" type="main" key="su^perse_mi^na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpersēmĭnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>supersemino</etym>, <sense id="n46860.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who sows upon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in addition</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
supersemino: <entryFree id="n46861" type="main" key="su^perse_mi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-sēmĭno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46861.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to</hi> <cb n="SUPE" /> <hi rend="ital">sow upon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">over</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Prax. 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 30, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
supersero: <entryFree id="n46862" type="main" key="su^perse^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-sĕro</orth>, <itype>sēvi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46862.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sow over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sow in addition</hi>, Hilar. in Psa. 127, 11; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> ib. 55</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
supersessus: <entryFree id="n46863" type="main" key="su^persessus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpersessus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of supersedeo.</entryFree>
supersiliens: <entryFree id="n46864" type="hapax" key="su^persi^li^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-sĭlĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [salio], <sense id="n46864.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">leaping</hi> or <hi rend="ital">alighting upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">volucris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:3:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 3, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
supersisto: <entryFree id="n46865" type="main" key="su^persisto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-sisto</orth>, <itype>stĭti, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46865.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to place one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self upon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stand upon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">over</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tribunal ligneum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 269, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicarium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8</bibl></cit>, p. 206, 20: <cit><quote lang="la">caeremoniali scientiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 1, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
superspero: <entryFree id="n46866" type="main" key="su^perspe_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-spēro</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46866.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hope exceedingly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:118:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 118, 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">118, 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
superspersus: <entryFree id="n46867" type="main" key="su^perspersus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-spersus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [spargo], <sense id="n46867.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">strewn</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sprinkled over</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">gemma stellis puniceis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 27 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">camelopardalis candidis maculis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 30 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, p. 280</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
superstagno: <entryFree id="n46868" type="main" key="su^perstagno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-stagno</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46868.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to spread out into a lake</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si amnis Nar in rivos deductus superstagnavisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 79</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
superstatumino: <entryFree id="n46869" type="hapax" key="su^persta^tu_mi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-stătūmĭno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46869.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to place above as a foundation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rudus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 9, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
supersterno: <entryFree id="n46870" type="main" key="su^persterno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-sterno</orth>, no <sense id="n46870.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>strātum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to strew</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spread upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to spread over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cover over</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">pavimenta testacea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superstrati cumuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:29:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 29, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fossam ponte solubili,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 8, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
superstes: <entryFree id="n46871" type="main" key="su^perste^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭperstĕs</orth>, <itype>ĭtis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>super-sto</etym>. <sense id="n46871.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who stands by</hi> or <hi rend="ital">is present at</hi> any thing, <hi rend="ital">a by-stander</hi>, <hi rend="ital">witness</hi> (only in the foll. passages): <cit><quote lang="la">superstites testes praesentes significat, cujus rei testimonium est, quod superstitibus praesentibus ei, inter quos controversia est, vindicias sumere jubentur. Plautus in Artemone: nunc mihi licet quidvis loqui, nemo hic adest superstes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=305" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 305</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 3, 339</bibl>: suis utrisque superstitibus praesentibus istam viam dico: inite viam, an old legal formula in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 12, 26</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n46871.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, pregn., <hi rend="ital">standing over</hi> as in triumph: <cit><quote lang="la">spoliisque animosa superstes, Unda, velut victrix, sinuataque despicit undas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:552" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 552</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:471" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 471</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46871.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That remains alive after another</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s death</hi>, <hi rend="ital">outliving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surviving</hi> (the predom. signif.); constr. usually with <hi rend="ital">dat.;</hi> less freq. with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46871.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut tuum vis unicum gnatum tuae Superesse vitae sospitem et superstitem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vitae tuae superstes suppetat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tibi superstes uxor aetatem siet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita mihi atque huic sies superstes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut viro tuo semper sis superstes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sui sibi liberi superstites essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:28:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 28, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superstes filio pater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:34:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 34, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 17, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi privatus superstes regno suo consenescat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:50:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 50, 8</bibl></cit>: patriae (Aeneas) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:42" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C. S. 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriae suae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">priscis illa superstes avis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceteri (liberi) superstites patri fuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenis tribus perna superstes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:48:17" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 48, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiberio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 5, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46871.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (mostly post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">utinam te non solum vitae, sed etiam dignitatis meae superstitem reliquissem!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alterius vestrum superstes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 48, 49, § 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superstes omnium meorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6</bibl></cit>, prooem. § 4; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium suorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:62" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 62 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iniquorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non modo aliorum sed etiam nostri superstites sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multique superstites bellorum infamiam laqueo finierunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n46871.5" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod superstitem Augustum reliquissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:59" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortem obiit repentinam superstitibus liberis, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberis superstitibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">6: per ecastor scitus puer est natus Pamphilo. Deos quaeso, ut sit superstes,</quote> <trans><tr>that he may live</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superstes hereditatem regni accipiam (sc. patri),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum aget pennā metuente solvi Fama superstes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me tamen exstincto fama superstes erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:7:50" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 7, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimidiā parte superstes ero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:2:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post mea mansurum fata superstes opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:15:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 15, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superstite Romā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:660" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 660</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(silva fertur) Nymphas etiam mutasse superstes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>survived their transformations</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:95" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 95</bibl></cit>. <cb n="SUPE" /></sense></entryFree>
superstillo: <entryFree id="n46872" type="main" key="su^perstillo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-stillo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46872.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to drop upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pour on drop by drop</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:8:7" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 8, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:9:13" default="NO">9, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:1:18" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 1, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
superstitio: <entryFree id="n46873" type="main" key="su^persti^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭperstĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>super-sto; orig a standing still over or by a thing; hence, amazement, wonder, dread, esp. of the divine or supernatural</etym>. <sense id="n46873.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Excessive fear of the goas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unreasonable religious belief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superstition</hi> (different from religio, a proper, reasonable awe of the gods; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">religio veri dei cultus est, superstitio falsi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 28, 11</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">horum sententiae omnium non modo superstitionem tollunt, in quā inest timor inanis deorum, sed etiam religionem, quae deorum cultu pio continetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:42:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 42, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majores nostri superstitionem a religione separaverunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 28, 71</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">contaminata superstitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:68:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 68, 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero superstitione tollendā religio tollitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:72:148" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 72, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superstitio error insanus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 123:16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 123, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superstitiones aniles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:28:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 28, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagarum superstitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:63:129" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 63, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:125" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magicas superstitiones objectabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exitialis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam multi, qui contemnant (somnia) eamque superstitionem imbecilli animi atque anilis putent!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:60:125" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 60, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">barbara superstitio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 28, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:4:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 4, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā (superstitione) qui est imbutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:18:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 18, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 1, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">victi superstitione animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">captus quādam superstitione animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 19, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna superstitio natalis amicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:417" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 417</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod novas superstitiones introduceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:4:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superstitio est timor superfluus et delirus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 8, 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superstitionem mihi excute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 121:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 121, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46873.1" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">superstitio praeceptorum,</quote> <trans><tr>an excessive regard</tr>, <tr>scrupulous observance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:85" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 85</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n46873.2" n="B" level="2"> Objectively, <hi rend="ital">an object that inspires dread</hi>: adjuro Stygii caput implacabile fontis, Una superstitio superis quae reddita divis, Verg A. 12, 817.—</sense><sense id="n46873.3" n="II" level="1"> In post-Aug. prose sometimes for religio, <hi rend="ital">religious awe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sanctity; a religious rite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus (virtutis) quādam superstitione teneantur, hanc ament,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:35" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:3:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 39, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superstitiones atque cura deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 41, 3, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
superstitiose: <entryFree id="n46874" type="main" key="su^persti^ti^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭperstĭtĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. superstitiosus <sense id="n46874.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
superstitiosus: <entryFree id="n46875" type="main" key="su^persti^ti^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭperstĭtĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>superstitio</etym>, <sense id="n46875.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of superstition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superstitious.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46875.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita factum est in superstitioso et religioso alterum vitii nomen alterum laudis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:28:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 28, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimium esse superstitiosum non oportere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:40:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 40, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">isti philosophi superstitiosi et paene fanatici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:57:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 57, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: nimiā et superstitiosā religione sese alligaverat, Nigid. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:9:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 9, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:41:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 41, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in omni divinatione imbecilli animi facile superstitiosa ista concipiunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 39, 81</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per omnia quasi superstitiosiores vos video,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:17:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 17, 22</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saeculum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Gnost. 2</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46875.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">soothsaying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prophetic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prophetical</hi> (ante-class.): superstitiosus quidem est; <cit><quote lang="la">vera praedicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 167</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid si ista aut superstitiosa aut hariola est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 95</bibl></cit>: hariolationes, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:31:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 31, 66</bibl> (Trag. v. 79 Vahl.): unde superstitiosa primum saeva evasit vox fera, Poët. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2, 56, 115</bibl> (Trag. Rel. Inc. v. 19 Rib.).—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭperstĭtĭōsē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n46875.3" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to I.) <hi rend="ital">Superstitiously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque id dicitis superstitiose aut aniliter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:39:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 39, 92</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:55:126" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 55, 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46875.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen. (cf. superstitio, I. A. 2.), <hi rend="ital">too scrupulously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">too nicely</hi> or <hi rend="ital">exactly</hi> (only in Quint.): <cit><quote lang="la">inhaerere cogitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:6:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 1, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
superstito: <entryFree id="n46876" type="main" key="su^persti^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭperstĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>superstes</etym>. * <sense id="n46876.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to keep alive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preserve</hi>: regnumque nostrum ut sospitent superstitentque, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 170, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">176, 3</bibl> (Trag. v. 331 Vahl.).—* </sense><sense id="n46876.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">remaining</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut mihi supersit, suppetat, superstitet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
supersto: <entryFree id="n46877" type="main" key="su^persto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-sto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n46877.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stand upon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">over</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">signa cum columnis, quibus superstabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">columnae (statua),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">essedis carrisque (hostis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:28:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 28, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruinis (armati),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporibus hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 24, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cumulus caesorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:59:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 59, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rupibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:27:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 27, 8</bibl></cit>: superstantes propugnaculis<pb n="1810" /> <cb n="SUPE" />  celsis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 6, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(quem) lapsum superstans Immolat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:540" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 540</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa inhumata (volucres),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 10, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora atque arma simul cumulata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:713" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 713</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">agger pondere superstantium in fossam procubuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum armati superstantes subissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 9, 8</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n46877.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To survive</hi> ( = superstitem esse; <cit><quote lang="la">eccl. Lat.),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ennod.</author> Epigr. 6, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
superstratus: <entryFree id="n46878" type="main" key="su^perstra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭperstrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of supersterno.</entryFree>
superstrictus: <entryFree id="n46879" type="main" key="su^perstrictus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭperstrictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of superstringo.</entryFree>
superstringo: <entryFree id="n46880" type="main" key="su^perstringo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-stringo</orth>, <itype>xi, strictum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46880.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bind</hi> or <hi rend="ital">draw together above</hi> or <hi rend="ital">over</hi> (postclass. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">manus accurate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 263, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
superstructus: <entryFree id="n46881" type="main" key="su^perstructus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭperstructus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of superstruo.</entryFree>
superstruo: <entryFree id="n46882" type="main" key="su^perstru^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-strŭo</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46882.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to build upon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to superstruct</hi> (postAug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ligneam compagem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1</bibl></cit> prooem. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidquid his (fundamentis) superstruxeris, corruet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desuper pulvillis superstruunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 248, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
supersubstantialis: <entryFree id="n46883" type="main" key="su^persubstanti^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpersubstantĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>supersubstantia</etym>, <sense id="n46883.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">necessary to support life</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">panis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 6, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
supersubstantivus: <entryFree id="n46884" type="main" key="su^persubstanti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpersubstantīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46884.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">supermaterial</hi> (eccl. Lat.): Christus nec substantiva nec insubstantiva, sed supersubstantiva res est, Rustic. c. Aceph. p. 1184.</sense></entryFree>
supersum: <entryFree id="n46885" type="main" key="su^persum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-sum</orth>, <itype>fui, esse</itype> (old collat. form of the <sense id="n46885.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pres.</hi> superescit, Enn. and Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=302" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 302</bibl> Müll.; <cit><quote lang="la">per tmesin: jamque adeo super unus eram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:567" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 567</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil erat super,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 8, 1</bibl></cit>), <pos>v. n.</pos> </sense><sense id="n46885.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To be over and above</hi>, either as a remainder or as a superfluity (class. and very freq.; cf. supero, B. 3.). </sense><sense id="n46885.2" n="A" level="2"> As a remainder, <hi rend="ital">to be left</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to remain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to exist still.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46885.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: dum quidem unus homo Romanus toga superescit, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=302" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 302</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 486 Vahl.): inde sibi memorat, unum superesse laborem, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:22:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 22, 16</bibl> (Ann. v. 159 ib.): <cit><quote lang="la">duae partes, quae mihi supersunt illustrandae orationis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:24:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 24, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nulli supersint de inimicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 7, 21</bibl></cit>: omnes qui supersint de Hirtii exercitu, Pollio ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:33:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 33, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid superest de corporibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:259" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 259</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:35" default="NO">1, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex eo proelio circiter milia hominum CXXX. superfuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perexigua pars illius exercitūs superest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod Morini Menapiique supererant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum hostes vestri tantum civium superfuturum putassent, quantum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum satietati superfuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 4, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum ipsi superesse potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:4:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">biduum supererat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non multum ad solis occasum temporis supererat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non multum aestatis superesset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fessis tantum superesse maris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:616" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 616</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatia si plura supersint,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 325</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos Ambraciensibus non superesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo superesse quemquam praeter eos credebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod superest, scribe quaeso quam accuratissime, quid placeat,</quote> <trans><tr>as for the rest</tr>, <tr>as to what remains</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 19, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:691" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 691</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod superfuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2</bibl></cit>, epil. 6: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc mihi cur cantent, superest Dicere,</quote> <trans><tr>it still remains to tell</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:675" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 675</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superest tercentum messes videre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 145</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 6, 6</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 23, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46885.4" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to live after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">outlive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be still alive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to survive</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">sicut tuum vis unicum gnatum tuae Superesse vitae sospitem et superstitem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: neque deesse neque superesse rei publicae volo, Pollio ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:33:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 33, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lucumo superfuit patri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne superesset tanto exercitui suum nomen secuto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:703" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 703</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum superessent adhuc qui spectaverant, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46885.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be in abundance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to abound</hi> (syn. abundo): <cit><quote lang="la">cui tanta erat res et supererat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi, quia superest, dolet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vereor ne jam superesse mihi verba putes, quae dixeram defutura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:63:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 63, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adeo supererunt animi ad sustinendam invidiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:27:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 27, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum illi ingenii superfuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 1</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: modo vita supersit, <hi rend="ital">if life be long</hi> <cb n="SUPE" /> <hi rend="ital">enough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffice</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne blando nequeant superesse labori,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to be sufficient for</tr>, <tr>equal to</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 127</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Veneri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:27:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 27, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46885.6" n="2" level="3"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">to be in excess</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be superabundant</hi> or <hi rend="ital">superfluous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vis ejus rei, quam definias, sic exprimatur, ut neque absit quicquam neque supersit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:25:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 25, 108</bibl></cit>; cf. Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:22:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 22, 5</bibl> and 6.—</sense><sense id="n46885.7" n="II" level="1"> For adesse, <hi rend="ital">to be present</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to serve by being present</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to assist</hi>: si superesset (opp. sin deesset), Aug. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 56</bibl>.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">to serve as an advocate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">falsa atque aliena verbi significatio, quod dicitur, hic illi superest, cum dicendum est, advocatum esse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:22:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 22, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46885.8" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To be over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">beyond</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be prominent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">project</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:760" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 760</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
supertectus: <entryFree id="n46886" type="main" key="su^pertectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpertectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of supertego.</entryFree>
supertego: <entryFree id="n46887" type="main" key="su^perte^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-tĕgo</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46887.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cover above</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cover over</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">candidaque ossa super nigra favilla tegit (per tmesin),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:2:10" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa congestu culmorum et frondium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:14:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 14, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid testa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me tunicā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 263, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plures frondibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:4:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 43, 4, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
supertendo: <entryFree id="n46888" type="main" key="su^pe^rtendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕr-tendo</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46888.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to stretch</hi> or <hi rend="ital">strain above</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">in augmento tumores supertendunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:9" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
superterrenus: <entryFree id="n46889" type="hapax" key="su^perterre_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-terrēnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46889.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is above the earth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superterrene</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
supertertius: <entryFree id="n46890" type="main" key="su^perterti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-tertĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>; of a number, <sense id="n46890.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one third as much more</hi> (i.e. that bears to another the ratio of 4 to 3): numerus, a transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)pi/triton,</foreign> <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> de Die Nat. 10, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, § 761 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
supertextor: <entryFree id="n46891" type="main" key="su^pertextor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-textor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46891.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chief-weaver</hi> (late Lat.), Mar. Merc. Procli. Hom. Sect. 3.</sense></entryFree>
supertollo: <entryFree id="n46892" type="main" key="su^pe^rtollo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕr-tollo</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46892.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to raise above</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Commod.</author> Instr. 61, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
supertraho: <entryFree id="n46893" type="hapax" key="su^pertra^ho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-trăho</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46893.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to draw over</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crates dentatas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 18, 48, § 173</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
supertranseo: <entryFree id="n46894" type="main" key="su^pertranse^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-transĕo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46894.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pass over</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 37, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
superumerale: <entryFree id="n46895" type="main" key="su^pe^rumerale"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕr-umerale</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-humer-</orth>), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>umerus</etym>, <sense id="n46895.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the upper garment of a Jewish priest</hi>, a transl. of Heb. <foreign />, <hi rend="ital">an ephod</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 28, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 29, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">64, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
superunctio: <entryFree id="n46896" type="hapax" key="su^pe^runcti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕrunctĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>superungo</etym>, <sense id="n46896.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a smearing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">anointing over</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:4:34" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 4, 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
superunctus: <entryFree id="n46897" type="main" key="su^pe^runctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕrunctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of superungo.</entryFree>
superundo: <entryFree id="n46898" type="hapax" key="su^pe^rundo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕr-undo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46898.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to overflow;</hi> trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">gratia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 18, 183</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
superungo: <entryFree id="n46899" type="main" key="su^pe^rungo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕr-ungo</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46899.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to smear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">anoint over</hi> (medical), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 29" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 80, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
superurgens: <entryFree id="n46900" type="hapax" key="su^pe^rurgens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕr-urgens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [urgeo], <sense id="n46900.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pressing from above</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctu superurgente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
superus: <entryFree id="n46901" type="main" key="su^pe^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (ante-class. collat. form of the <sense id="n46901.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. sing.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕr</orth> in two passages: <cit><quote lang="la">super inferque vicinus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 149, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totus super ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:649" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 649</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> in signif. I. B. 1. infra, superūm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 251</bibl> et saep.), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>super</etym>. </sense><sense id="n46901.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Posit.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46901.2" n="A" level="2"> <pos>Adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n46901.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">that is above</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">higher</hi>: inferus an superus tibi fert deus funera, Liv. And. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 606</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">at ita me di deaeque superi atque inferi et medioxumi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes di deaeque superi, inferi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad superos deos potius quam ad inferos pervenisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limen superum inferumque salve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portae Phrygiae limen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 9, 63</bibl>; Novat. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 336, 13</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 49 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">carmine di superi placantur, carmine manes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">di,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 1, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 7, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">superis deorum Gratus et imis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut omnia supera, infera, prima, ultima, media videremus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:26:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 26, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectatores superarum rerum atque caelestium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:56:140" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 56, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes caelicolas, omnes supera alta tenentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:788" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 788</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supera ad convexa,</quote> <trans><tr>to heaven</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 241</bibl></cit> (Rib. super); 6, 750; 10, 251: cum superum lumen nox intempesta teneret, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1, 14</bibl> (Ann. v. 106 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">lumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:856" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 856</bibl></cit>: templum superi Jovis, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of the Capitoline Jupiter</hi> (opp. Juppiter inferus, i. e. Pluto), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:55:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 55, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 48" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:735" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 735</bibl></cit>: mare superum, <hi rend="ital">the upper</hi>, <cb n="SUPE" /> i. e. <hi rend="ital">the Adriatic and Ionian Sea</hi> (opp. mare inferum, the lower or Etruscan Sea), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:19:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 19, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 10, § 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">44</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so without mare (colloq.): iter ad superum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.—Adverb.: <cit><quote lang="la">de supero, quom huc accesserit,</quote> <trans><tr>from above</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 4, 18</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ex supero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 227</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:241" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 241</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:248" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 248</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n46901.4" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">upper</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of the upper regions</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upper world</hi> (opp. the lower regions): <cit><quote lang="la">superā de parte,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the earth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:855" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 855</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superas evadere ad auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superum ad lumen ire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 680</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:641" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 641</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 680</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46901.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46901.6" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŭpĕri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n46901.7" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">They who are above</hi> (opp. inferi, those in the dungeon), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 7, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum fleti ad superos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>those living on earth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:481" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 481</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Pompeius) Quam apud superos habuerat magnitudinem, illibatam detulisset ad Inferos,</quote> <trans><tr>the inhabitants of the upper world</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:48:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 48, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut oblitos superum paterere dolores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:792" default="NO"><author>Val.
