Fl.</author> 1, 792</bibl></cit>: si nunc redire posset ad superos pater, Poët. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 5, p. 252</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistula ad superos scripta,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to the survivors</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 109, 112, § 248</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46901.8" n="(b)" level="5"> (Sc. di.) <hi rend="ital">The gods above</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the celestial deities</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae Superi Manesque dabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspiciunt Superi mortalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o Superi!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:196" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 196</bibl></cit>; 14, 729; <cit><quote lang="la">pro Superi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:2:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 2, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terris jactatus et alto Vi Superum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa propago Contemptrix Superum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exemplo Superorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:4:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 4, 19</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Superorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:1:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam res Asiae Priamique evertere gentem Immeritam visum Superis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scilicet is Superis labor est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 379</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 6, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">superis deorum Gratus et imis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flectere Superos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:312" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 312</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te per Superos ... oro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 141</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n46901.9" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕra</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n46901.10" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The heavenly bodies</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hicetas caelum, solem, lunam, stellas, supera denique omnia stare censet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 39, 123</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitantes supera atque caelestia, haec nostra contemnimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 41, 127</bibl></cit>: di, quibus est potestas motūs superūm atque inferūm, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 25, 38</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 163 Vahl.).—</sense><sense id="n46901.11" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Higher places</hi> (sc. loca): <cit><quote lang="la">supera semper petunt,</quote> <trans><tr>tend upwards</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:18:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 18, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Alecto) Cocyti petit sedem, supera ardua relinquens,</quote> <trans><tr>the upper world</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:562" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 562</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n46901.12" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕrĭor</orth>, ĭus. </sense><sense id="n46901.13" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of place, <hi rend="ital">higher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upper</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inferiore omni spatio vacuo relicto, superiorem partem collis castris compleverant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dejectus quī potest esse quisquam, nisi in inferiorem locum de superiore motus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:18:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 18, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in superiore qui habito cenaculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tota domus superior vacat,</quote> <trans><tr>the upper part of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superior accumbere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de loco superiore dicere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>from the tribunal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:42:section=102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 42, § 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>from the rostra</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>, § 14; <cit><quote lang="la">and in gen. of the position of the speaker: multos et ex superiore et ex aequo loco sermones habitos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive ex inferiore loco sive ex aequo sive ex superiore loquitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 6, 23</bibl></cit>: ex loco superiore in ipsis fluminis ripis praeliabantur, <hi rend="ital">from a height</hi> or <hi rend="ital">eminence</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 23</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ex loco superiore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 3, 2: ex superioribus locis in planitiem descendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui in superiore acie constiterant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex superiore et ex inferiore scripturā docendum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>what goes before and after</tr>, <tr>the context</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:40:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 40, 117</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">posteriori superius non jungitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 14, 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46901.14" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46901.15" n="1" level="3"> Of time or order of succession, <hi rend="ital">former</hi>, <hi rend="ital">past</hi>, <hi rend="ital">previous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preceding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">superiores solis defectiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:16:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 16, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid proxima, quid superiore nocte egeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">refecto ponte, quem superioribus diebus hostes resciderant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superioribus aestivis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:46" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superioribus temporibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus (opp. posterius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:37:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 37, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora (opp. inferiora),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:18:section=47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 18, § 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anno superiore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 8, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superioris anni acta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in superiore vitā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:8:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 8, 26</bibl></cit>: milites superioribus proeliis exercitati, <pb n="1811" /> <cb n="SUPE" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">testimonium conveniens superiori facto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:53" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superius facinus novo scelere vincere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:44:section=116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 44, § 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superioris more crudelitatis uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Thras. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superius genus,</quote> <trans><tr>mentioned previously</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 25, 48, § 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuptiae,</quote> <trans><tr>former marriage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir,</quote> <trans><tr>first husband</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 6, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46901.16" n="b" level="4"> Esp., of age, time of life, etc., <hi rend="ital">older</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">senior</hi>, <hi rend="ital">more advanced</hi>, <hi rend="ital">former</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis juventus omnesque superioris aetatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetate superiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:10:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superior Africanus,</quote> <trans><tr>the Elder</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:10:section=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 10, § 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:33:121" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 33, 121</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dionysius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 7, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 1, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est aetas hominis, nisi memoria rerum veterum cum superiorum aetate contexitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:34:120" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 34, 120</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46901.17" n="2" level="3"> Of strength or success in battle or any contest, <hi rend="ital">victorious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conquering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stronger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superior</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar quod hostes equitatu superiores esse intellegebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numero superiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:12" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc ipso fiunt superiores, quod nullum acceperant detrimentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:ib. 8:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se quo impudentius egerit, hoc superiorem discessurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semper discessit superior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si primo proelio Catilina superior discessisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 39:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 39, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nostri omnibus partibus superiores fuerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multo superiores bello esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superiorem Appium in causā fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 7, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46901.18" n="3" level="3"> Of quality, condition, number, etc., <hi rend="ital">higher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">more distinguished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">greater</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superior.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46901.19" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">abl. respect.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniis superiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:34:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 34, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loco, fortunā, famā superiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:25:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 25, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habes neminem honoris gradu superiorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facilitate et humanitate superior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:26:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 26, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si superior ceteris rebus esses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:19:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 19, 61</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46901.20" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ii, qui superiores sunt, submittere se debent in amicitiā, sic quodam modo inferiores extollere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:20:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 20, 72</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 20, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quanto superiores sumus, tanto nos geramus summissius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:26:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 26, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invident homines maxime paribus aut inferioribus ... sed etiam superioribus invidetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:52:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 52, 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">premendoque superiorem sese extollebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:12:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 12, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui omnem honorem, ut superiori habuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:101:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 101, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n46901.21" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, in three forms, ‡ superrimus, supremus, and summus. </sense><sense id="n46901.22" n="A" level="2"> ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭperrĭ-mus</orth>, assumed as orig. form of supremus by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=51" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 51</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 130</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n46901.23" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sū^prēmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">highest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loftiest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">topmost.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46901.24" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">summus, C. 1.): montesque sŭpremos Silvifragis vexat flabris,</quote> <trans><tr>the highest points</tr>, <tr>the tops</tr>, <tr>summits</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 274</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:460" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 460</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:68" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rupes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 95" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arx,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> III. Cons. Hon. 167</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">supremae Tethyos unda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Spect. 3:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> Spect. 3, 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n46901.25" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46901.26" n="a" level="4"> Of time or order of succession, <hi rend="ital">last</hi>, <hi rend="ital">latest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extreme</hi>, <hi rend="ital">final</hi>, = ultimus (class.). </sense><sense id="n46901.27" n="(a)" level="5"> In gen.: SOL OCCASVS SVPREMA TEMPESTAS ESTO, XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:2:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 2, 10</bibl>.—Hence, as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">suprēma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. tempestas), <hi rend="ital">the last part of the day</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the hour of sunset</hi>: suprema summum diei; hoc tempus duodecim Tabulae dicunt occasum esse solis; <cit><quote lang="la">sed postea lex praetoria id quoque tempus jubet esse supremum, quo praeco in comitio supremam pronuntiavit populo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 5</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> de Die Nat. 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 60, 60, § 212</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (urbs), quia postrema coaedificata est, Neapolis nominatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:53:section=119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 53, § 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supremo te sole domi manebo,</quote> <trans><tr>at sunset</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jubare exorto jam nocte supremā, Col. poët. 10, 294: in te suprema salus,</quote> <trans><tr>last hope</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:653" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 653</bibl></cit>: supremam bellis imposuisse manum, <hi rend="ital">the last</hi> or <hi rend="ital">finishing hand</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 114</bibl>. —<orth extent="full" lang="la">suprēmum</orth>, adverb., <hi rend="ital">for the last time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae mihi tunc primum, tunc est conspecta supremum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:526" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 526</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46901.28" n="(b)" level="5"> In partic., with regard to the close of life, <hi rend="ital">last</hi>, <hi rend="ital">closing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dying</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">supremo vitae die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:29:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 29, 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:21:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 21, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:36:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 36, 75</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 14, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:13:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 13, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 4, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:59" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 98</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 151</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">incestum pontifices supremo supplicio sanciunto,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the penalty of death</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:9:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">finis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:17:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 17, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:735" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 735</bibl></cit>: sociamque tori vocat ore supremo, <hi rend="ital">with his dying mouth</hi>, <cb n="SUPE" /> <hi rend="ital">dying breath</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:521" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 521</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:3:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 3, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec digressu dicta supremo Fundebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:583" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 583</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nero in supremā irā duos calices crystallinos fregit,</quote> <trans><tr>in his last agony</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 10, § 29</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">supremis suis annis,</quote> <trans><tr>in his last years</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 1, 27, § 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suprema ejus cura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 45, 46, § 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spoliatus illius supremi diei celebritate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:32:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 32, 86</bibl></cit>: honor, <hi rend="ital">the last honors</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">funeral rites</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ceremonies</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">funera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oscula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:278" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 278</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tori,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>biers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:668" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 668</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:15:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 15, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:620" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 620</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 583</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">officia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 112, 1</bibl>: judicia hominum, <hi rend="ital">a last will</hi> or <hi rend="ital">testament</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:92" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 20, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:31:5" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 31, 5</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">tabulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:33:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 33, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:41:1" default="NO">5, 41, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tituli,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>an epitaph</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:ib. 9:19:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 19, 3</bibl></cit>.—So of cities, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Troiae sorte supremā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies regnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:852" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 852</bibl></cit>. — <orth extent="full" lang="la">suprēmum</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">suprēmō</orth>, adverb.: <cit><quote lang="la">animam sepulcro Condimus, et magnā supremum voce ciemus,</quote> <trans><tr>for the last time</tr>, <tr>for a last farewell</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 55, § 150</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:526" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 526</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">anima exitura supremo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:277" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 53, 115, § 277</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46901.29" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭ-prēmum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the last moment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">end</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ventum ad supremum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:803" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 803</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46901.30" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">suprēma</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n46901.31" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The last moments</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the close of life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">death</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut me in supremis consolatus est!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6</bibl></cit>, prooem. § 11; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 50</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 66</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">statua Herculis sentiens suprema tunicae,</quote> <trans><tr>the last agonies caused by it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circa suprema Neronis,</quote> <trans><tr>the time of his death</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 44, 86, § 236</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:33" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 3, 3, § 33</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n46901.32" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The last honors</hi> paid to the dead, <hi rend="ital">funeral rites</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ceremonies</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a funeral</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">supremis divi Augusti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 3, 3, § 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:236" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 44, 86, § 236</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 61</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 49</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 59</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suprema ferre (sc. munera),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 213</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 25</bibl> al.— </sense><sense id="n46901.33" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A last will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">testament</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil primo senatus die agi passus, nisi de supremis Augusti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles in supremis ordinandis ignarus uxorem esse praegnantem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:1:36:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 1, 36, § 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46901.34" n="(d)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The relics</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remains</hi> of a burned corpse, <hi rend="ital">the ashes</hi>, = reliquiae, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 25, 9, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n46901.35" n="b" level="4"> Of degree or rank, <hi rend="ital">the highest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">greatest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">most exalted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supreme</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa, quae appellatur suprema, instituta in singulos duarum ovium, triginta boum ... ultra quam (numerum) multam dicere in singulos jus non est, et propterea suprema appellatur, id est, summa et maxima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:1:2 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 1, 2 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">macies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:590" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 590</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter supreme,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 9, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 66</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 42</bibl>: Junonis supremus conjunx, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 37, § 115</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">med antidhac Supremum habuisti com item consiliis tuis,</quote> <trans><tr>most intimate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46901.36" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">summus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>from sup-ĭmus, sup-mus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">uppermost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">highest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">topmost; the top of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">highest part of</hi> (cf. Roby, Gram. 2, § 1295). </sense><sense id="n46901.37" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class., while supremus is mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">summum oportet olfactare vestimentum muliebre,</quote> <trans><tr>the top</tr>, <tr>outside of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 56</bibl></cit>: Galli summa arcis adorti Moenia, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 4</bibl> (Ann. v. 169 Vahl.): Thyestes summis saxis fixus, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:44:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 44, 107</bibl> (Trag. v. 413 ib.): montibus summis, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:71" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, 71</bibl> Müll. (Epigr. v. 43 ib.): <cit><quote lang="la">summum jugum montis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summus mons,</quote> <trans><tr>the top of</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feriunt summos fulmina montes,</quote> <trans><tr>the mountain tops</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:10:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 10, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: in summo montis vertice, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:48" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus castrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in summā sacrā viā,</quote> <trans><tr>on the highest part of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 7, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:53:section=119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 53, § 119</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in summā columnā conlocare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:24:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 24, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (urbem) ad summum theatrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:53:section=119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 53, § 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Janus summus ab imo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad aquam summam appropinquare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:23:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 23, 64</bibl></cit>: mento summam aquam attingens enectus siti, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:5:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 5, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aquā summā natare,</quote> <trans><tr>the top</tr>, <tr>surface of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud summum puteum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per summa volare aequora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:819" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 819</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa cacumina linquunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 678</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mari summo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prospexi Italiam summā ab undā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 357</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summaque per galeam delibans oscula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 434</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amphoras complures complet plumbo, summas operit auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 9, 3</bibl></cit>: summa <cb n="SUPE" /> procul villarum culmina fumant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">summam cutem novaculā decerpito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:56:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 56, 1</bibl></cit>.—Of position, place, at table: <cit><quote lang="la">summus ego (in triclinio) et prope me Viscus Thurinus et infra Varius, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>I was highest</tr>, <tr>I reclined at the top</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 20</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">summus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">he who sits in the highest place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at the head of the table</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">standum est in lecto, si quid de summo petas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: is sermo, qui more majorum a summo adhibetur in poculis, <hi rend="ital">by the head of the table</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">by the president of the feast</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:14:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 14, 46</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">a summo dare (bibere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:1:19" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 1, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46901.38" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">summum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the top</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surface; the highest place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the head of the table</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ab ejus (frontis) summo, sicut palmae, rami quam late diffunduntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui demersi sunt in aquā ... si non longe absunt a summo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:14:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 14, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leviter a summo inflexum bacillum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:17:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 17, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">igitur discubuere . . . in summo Antonius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 3, 4</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">puteos ac potius fontes habet: sunt enim in summo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuces mersit in vinum et sive in summum redierant, sive subsederant, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 137 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: oratori summa riguerunt, <hi rend="ital">the extremities</hi> of his body, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:3:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 3, 3</bibl>.—In mal. part.: <cit><quote lang="la">summa petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:46:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 46, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 76</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46901.39" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the voice: <cit><quote lang="la">jubeo te salvere voce summā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">citaret Io Bacche! modo summā Voce, modo, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>at the top of his voice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox (opp. ima),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summā voce versus multos uno spiritu pronuntiare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:61:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 61, 261</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">summo haec clamore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:prol. 59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. prol. 59</bibl></cit>. —Adverb.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">summum</orth>, <hi rend="ital">at the utmost</hi> or <hi rend="ital">farthest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exspectabam hodie, aut summum cras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 21, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bis, terve summum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triduo aut summum quatriduo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 9, 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 35</bibl>, and 31, 42 Drak.—</sense><sense id="n46901.40" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46901.41" n="a" level="4"> Of time or order of succession, <hi rend="ital">last</hi>, <hi rend="ital">latest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">final</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">haec est praestituta summa argento dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 140</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">venit summa dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:324" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 324</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad summam senectutem jactari, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: vixit ad summam senectutem, <hi rend="ital">to extreme old age</hi>, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 401, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum esset summā senectute,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 10, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in fluvium primi cecidere, in corpora summi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summo carmine,</quote> <trans><tr>at the end</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:28:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 28, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eadem in argumentis ratio est, ut potentissima prima et summa ponantur,</quote> <trans><tr>the first and the last</tr>, <tr>at the beginning and the end</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 4, 22</bibl></cit>; cf. <hi rend="ital">neutr. absol.</hi>: Celsus putat, primo firmum aliquod (argumentum) esse ponendum, summo firmissimum, imbecilliora medio; <cit><quote lang="la">quia et initio movendus sit judex et summo impellendus,</quote> <trans><tr>at the last</tr>, <tr>at the close</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 1, 10</bibl></cit>.— Adverb.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">summum</orth>, <hi rend="ital">for the last time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc ego te infelix summum teneoque tuorque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0800,001:1:137" default="NO"><author>Albin.</author> 1, 137</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46901.42" n="b" level="4"> Of rank, etc., <hi rend="ital">highest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">greatest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">first</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supreme</hi>, <hi rend="ital">best</hi>, <hi rend="ital">utmost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extreme; most distinguished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellent</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">noble; most important</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weighty</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">critical</hi>, etc. (so most freq. in prose and poetry): summā nituntur vi, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 168 Vahl.): bellum gerentes summum summā industriā, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 402, 3</bibl> (Trag. v. 104 ib.): <cit><quote lang="la">summi puerorum amores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:10:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes civium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides, constantia justitiaque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 25</bibl></cit>: in amore summo summāque inopiā, Caec. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:29:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 29, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui in virtute summum bonum ponunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non agam summo jure tecum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:2:section=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tres fratres summo loco nati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui summo magistratui praeerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concedunt in uno Cn. Pompeio summa esse omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:17:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 17, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (vitia) summo opere vitare oportebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:18:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 18, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:17:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 17, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summum in cruciatum se venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiems,</quote> <trans><tr>the depth of winter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:40:section=86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 40, § 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:60:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 60, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aestas summa esse coeperat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:12:section=29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 12, § 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 31, § 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut summi virtute et animo praeessent imbecillioribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:34:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 34, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summi ex Graeciā sapientissimique homines,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 22, 36</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">summi homines ac summis ingeniis praediti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optimi et summi viri diligentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:35:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 35, 54</bibl></cit>: cum par habetur honos summis et infimis <pb n="1812" /> <cb n="SUPE" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 34, 53</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">He.</hi> Quo honore'st illic? <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Summo atque ab summis viris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">summus Juppiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi summus imperator non adest ad exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles summi inperatoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 10, 28</bibl></cit>: deum qui non summum putet (amorem), Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:32:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 32, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicus summus,</quote> <trans><tr>the best friend</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 8</bibl></cit> (9), 60; 1, 1, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 5, 6, 6</bibl>; cf. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam is nostro Simulo fuit summus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 54</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 40</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> in <hi rend="ital">neutr. plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa ducum Atrides,</quote> <trans><tr>the chief</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:9:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 9, 37</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">summo rei publicae tempore,</quote> <trans><tr>at a most important period</tr>, <tr>most critical juncture</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:17:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 17, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in summo et periculosissimo rei publicae tempore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 3, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">summa salus rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: quod summa res publica in hujus periculo tentatur, <hi rend="ital">the highest welfare of the State</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the common welfare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the good of the State</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the whole State</hi> or <hi rend="ital">commonwealth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:51:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 51, 148</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">res publica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:27:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 27, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:10:section=28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 10, § 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 6, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:16:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 16, 23</bibl>; Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 14, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad summam rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:45:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 45, 4 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo res summa loco, Panthu?</quote> <trans><tr>the general cause</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:322" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 322</bibl></cit>: mene igitur socium summis adjungere rebus, Nise, fugis? <hi rend="ital">in these enterprises of highest moment</hi>, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 199</bibl>; esp.: summum jus, <hi rend="ital">a right pushed to an extreme</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non agam summo jure tecum,</quote> <trans><tr>deal exactingly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:2:section=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: exsistunt etiam saepe injuriae calumniā quādam et nimis callidā juris interpretatione; <cit><quote lang="la">ex quo illud summum jus summa injuria factum est, jam tritum sermone proverbium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:10:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 10, 33</bibl></cit>. — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">summē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">in the highest degree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">most highly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">greatly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extremely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod me sollicitare summe solet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:72:295" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 72, 295</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupere aliquid,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 21, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contendere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 24, 77</bibl></cit>: studere, Mat. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 28, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">diffidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">admirari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:70" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summe jucundum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officiosi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:24:section=63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 24, § 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summe disertus vir,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summe munitus locus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summe haec omnia mihi videntur esse laudanda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:17:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 17, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mei summe observantissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 26</bibl></cit> (11), 1.</sense></entryFree>
supervacaneus: <entryFree id="n46902" type="main" key="su^perva^ca_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-văcānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vacuus</etym>, <sense id="n46902.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">over and above what is necessary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">needless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unnecessary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superfluous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supervacaneous</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vasa,</quote> <trans><tr>supernumerary</tr>, <tr>extra</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>done at leisure hours</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:16:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 16, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commemoratio officiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">defensio Pauli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:12" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instituta (opp. necessaria),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Rhet. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid supervacaneum sit, aut usum non habeat, obstare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:35:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 35, 99</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia ita nata atque ita locata sunt, ut nihil eorum supervacaneum sit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 47, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">descriptio omnium corporis partium, in quā nihil inane, nihil sine causā, nihil supervacaneum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 33, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de timore supervacaneum est disserere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:58:11" default="NO" valid="yes">58, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin alter consul pro supervacaneo atque inutili habeatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 24</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-văcānĕō</orth>, <hi rend="ital">uselessly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superfluously.</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad Caes. 4:3" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad Caes. 4, 3 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
supervaco: <entryFree id="n46903" type="hapax" key="su^perva^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-văco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46903.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be superfluous</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:22:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 22, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
supervacue: <entryFree id="n46904" type="main" key="su^pe^rva^cu^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpĕrvăcŭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. supervacuus, <sense id="n46904.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> b.</sense></entryFree>
supervacuitas: <entryFree id="n46905" type="main" key="su^perva^cu^i^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpervăcŭĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>supervacuus</etym>, <sense id="n46905.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">vainglory</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:14:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 14, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
supervacuo: <entryFree id="n46906" type="main" key="su^perva^cu^o_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpervăcŭō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. supervacuus, <sense id="n46906.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> a.</sense></entryFree>
supervacuus: <entryFree id="n46907" type="main" key="su^perva^cu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-văcŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46907.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">useless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">needless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unnecessary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superfluous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">redundant</hi> (not ante-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">while supervacaneus is class.): omne supervacuum pleno de pectore manat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:337" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 337</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tam obest audire supervacua quam ignorare necessaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:8:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 7, 24, § 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 36, 64, § 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 9, 64, § 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frondes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:5:19" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi Baias Musa supervacuas Antonius facit,</quote> <trans><tr>of no benefit</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sepulcri honores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:20:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 20, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:7:6" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultus lupini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:11:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 11, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doctrina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:8:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:52" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:7:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:50" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">littera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: dolium,<cb n="SUPE" />  <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 219, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod monere supervacuum fuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:45" default="NO">11, 2, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 26:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 26, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 10, 74, § 121</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui dicit: tu occidisti, supervacuum habet postea dicere: ego non occidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quale sit describere supervacuum habeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 99, § 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diligentiam in supervacuis adfectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 1, 1, § 9</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> with <hi rend="ital">prepp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res ad praecavendum vel ex supervacuo movit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:37:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 37, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est iracundia in supervacuum tumultuante frigidius?</quote> <trans><tr>to no purpose</tr>, <tr>uselessly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:11:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 11, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 1:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 70:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 70, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adjectio vicini pro supervacuo habenda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:4:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 4, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superfluously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uselessly.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46907.1" n="a" level="4"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpervăcŭō</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 25, 30, § 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:7:14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 7, 14 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:1:64" default="NO">18, 1, 64</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n46907.2" n="b" level="4"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpervăcŭē</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 5, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Mart. 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 24, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">34, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
supervado: <entryFree id="n46908" type="main" key="su^perva_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-vādo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46908.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">climb over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to surmount</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">omnes asperitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 75:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 75, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruinas muri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 24, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munimenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:38:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 38, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
supervaganea: <entryFree id="n46909" type="gloss" key="su^perva^ga_ne^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpervăgānĕa</orth> <itype>dicebatur ab auguribus avis quae ex summo cacumine vocem emisisset, dicta ita, quia super omnia vagatur aut canit</itype>, Fest. pp. 304 and 305 Müll.</entryFree>
supervagor: <entryFree id="n46910" type="main" key="su^perva^gor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-văgor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n46910.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wander too far</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spread too much</hi>, of vine creepers, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:21:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 21, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:22:4" default="NO">4, 22, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
supervaleo: <entryFree id="n46911" type="main" key="su^perva^le^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-vălĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46911.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to surpass greatly</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 43, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
supervector: <entryFree id="n46912" type="hapax" key="su^pervector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-vector</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n46912.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pass</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hover over</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritus ab initio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Bapt. 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
superveho: <entryFree id="n46913" type="main" key="su^perve^ho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-vĕho</orth>, <itype>vexi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46913.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to carry over</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cumulis montibusque harenarum supervectis (i. e. by the wind),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:11:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 11, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
supervehor: <entryFree id="n46914" type="main" key="su^perve^hor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-vĕhor</orth>, <itype>vectus, 3</itype>, <sense id="n46914.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to go</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ride</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sail</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">past</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">montem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 66, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promontorium Calabriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:48:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 48, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma tua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos universos montibus harenarum supervectis operuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:11:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 11, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46914.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To ride</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ride upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pullo asinae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 8, 59</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
supervenio: <entryFree id="n46915" type="main" key="su^perve^ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-vĕnĭo</orth>, <itype>vēni, ventum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n46915.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to come over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to come to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in addition to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to overtake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to come up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fall upon</hi> (not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n46915.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46915.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n46915.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et heres Heredem alterius, velut unda supervenit undam,</quote> <trans><tr>follows after</tr>, <tr>presses upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crura loquentis Terra supervenit,</quote> <trans><tr>closed over</tr>, <tr>covered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:490" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 490</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vineae superveniunt jugum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:22" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 22</bibl></cit>. 1: <cit><quote lang="la">planitiem supervenit umor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si festinaret sequi, palantes superventurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:13:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 13, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 185</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46915.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">addit se sociam timidisque supervenit Aegle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semianimi lapsoque supervenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 356</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parantibus jam oppugnare supervenit a Creüsā praetor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:56:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 56, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munientibus supervenit Marcellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:35:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 35, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 7, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 29, 4</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic laetitiae Quintius supervenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:40:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 40, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulcus ulceri supervenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (febris) vel levi vulneri supervenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 26, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quotiens imbres superveniunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 15" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum nox occasionem daret, securis et laetis superveniendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:11:12" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 11, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inopinantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:3:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibusdam (insectorum) pinnarum tutelae crusta supervenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 28, 34, § 97</bibl></cit>. — Without <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Laelius Fulviusque ab Romā supervenerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:25:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 25, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 6, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:28:17" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 28, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntii ab Urbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla auxilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superveniunt deinde legati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:1:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 1, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:15:18" default="NO">4, 15, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tandem signa legionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 28, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tertia aquila,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbres superveniunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 15" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grata superveniet quae non sperabitur hora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 4, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46915.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of animals, <hi rend="ital">to leap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cover</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:24:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 24, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:6:3" default="NO">7, 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 63, 83, § 174</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46915.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to come upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be added to; to go beyond</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surpass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exceed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne tempus opimandi quintam et vigesimam lunam superveniat,</quote> <trans><tr>go beyond</tr>, <tr>exceed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:7:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis teneros supervenit annos,</quote> <trans><tr>attacks suddenly</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliud majus alio supervenit,</quote> <trans><tr>is added to</tr>, <tr>follows</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc donis Argia nitet, vilesque sororis Ornatus sacro praeculta supervenit auro,</quote> <trans><tr>surpasses</tr>, <tr>exceeds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:298" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 298</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
superventio: <entryFree id="n46916" type="main" key="su^perventio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭperventio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>supervenio</etym>, <sense id="n46916.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a</hi> <cb n="SUPI" /> <hi rend="ital">coming up</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> Chrysol. Serm. 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
superventores: <entryFree id="n46917" type="hapax" key="su^pervento_res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭperventōres</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>supervenio</etym>, <sense id="n46917.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of soldiers</hi> (perh. employed in sudden attacks), <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 9, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
superventus: <entryFree id="n46918" type="main" key="su^perventus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭperventus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46918.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a coming up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an arrival</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n46918.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 15, 13, § 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 54</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n46918.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">an attack</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
supervestio: <entryFree id="n46919" type="main" key="su^pervesti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-vestĭo</orth>, <itype>ītus, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46919.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to clothe upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clothe</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 14, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Cor. 5, 4</bibl>: maleficos homines taedā et papyro, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:156" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 156</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> in Psa. 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
supervinco: <entryFree id="n46920" type="main" key="su^pervinco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-vinco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46920.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to overcome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conquer</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Gnost. 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 6, 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
