supervivo: <entryFree id="n46921" type="main" key="supervi_vo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">super-vīvo</orth>, <itype>xi, ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46921.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to outlive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">survive</hi> (post-Aug.; cf. supersum); with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Olympias non diu filiis supervixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:3:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 28, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriae suae triginta annis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expeditioni superfuit et supervixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:2:14" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 2, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Had. 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 108, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4</bibl>, p. 147, 22.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:89" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:21:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 21, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 3, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
supervolito: <entryFree id="n46922" type="hapax" key="su^pervo^li^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-vŏlĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46922.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fly over often</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fly about over</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sua tecta alis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 56 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
supervolo: <entryFree id="n46923" type="main" key="su^pervo^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-vŏlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n46923.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fly over</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">totum supervolat orbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:624" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 624</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supervolantes alte alites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 14, 14, § 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:8:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 8, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tremebunda supervolat hasta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:522" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 522</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
supervolvo: <entryFree id="n46924" type="main" key="su^pervolvo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭper-volvo</orth>, <itype>volvi, vŏlūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46924.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to roll over</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">cylindrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:34" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se quinque partibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 970</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
supinalis: <entryFree id="n46925" type="main" key="Su^pi_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŭpīnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>supinus</etym>, <sense id="n46925.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an epithet of Jupiter</hi>, as he who overthrows, i. e. destroys, Aug. Civ. Dei, 7, 11.</sense></entryFree>
supinatio: <entryFree id="n46926" type="main" key="su^pi_na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpīnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>supino</etym>; in medic. lang., of the stomach, <sense id="n46926.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a casting back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rejection</hi> of food, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:3:64" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 3, 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
supine: <entryFree id="n46927" type="main" key="su^pi_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpīnē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. supinus <sense id="n46927.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
supinitas: <entryFree id="n46928" type="main" key="su^pi_ni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpīnĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>supinus</etym>, <sense id="n46928.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bending backwards</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n46928.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">est odiosa omnis supinitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:122" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 122</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46928.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Planasia (insula) de supinitate sic vocata,</quote> <trans><tr>its lying flat</tr>, <tr>flatness</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 3, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
supino: <entryFree id="n46929" type="main" key="su^pi_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpīno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46929.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bend</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lay backwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">throw</hi> a person or thing <hi rend="ital">on the back</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">manus modice supinata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:100" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 100</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:119" default="NO">11, 3, 119</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">supinata testudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 121:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 121, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles supinatus humi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 236</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8</bibl>, p. 211, 7: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in terga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:789" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 789</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi equitem supinant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 394</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora prona supinat (regina),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 290</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">currum temone erecto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 414</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante supinatas Aquiloni ostendere glebas,</quote> <trans><tr>turned over</tr>, <tr>ploughed up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 261</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Parnason tauris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:347" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 347</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nasum nidore supinor,</quote> <trans><tr>I turn up my nose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supinari,</quote> <trans><tr>to lie along</tr>, <tr>extend</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:243" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 243</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcus supinatus,</quote> <trans><tr>bent</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 2, 852</bibl></cit> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:13:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 13, 2</bibl>, the correct read. is resupinet).</sense></entryFree>
supinus: <entryFree id="n46930" type="main" key="su^pi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>from sub; cf. <foreign lang="greek">u(/ptios,</foreign> from <foreign lang="greek">u(po/, u(pai/</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n46930.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">backwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bent backwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thrown backwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lying on the back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supine</hi> (opp. pronus, cernuus). </sense><sense id="n46930.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46930.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (freq. and class.), of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">stertitque supinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 33</bibl>: pater excitat supinum juvenem, i. e <hi rend="ital">in bed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:190" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 190</bibl>.—Of animals, parts of the body, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">animal omne, ut vult, ita utitur motu sui corporis, prono, obliquo, supino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:53:120" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 53, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">refracta videntur omnia converti sursumque supina reverti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:441" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 441</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid nunc supina sursum in caelum conspicis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubitus,</quote> <trans><tr>a lying on the back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 14, § 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <trans><tr>thrown back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:69" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 11, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testudines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 4, 14, § 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 8, 8, § 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnans falce supinā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:201" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 201</bibl></cit>: tendoque supinas Ad caelum cum voce manus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">with the open palms turned upwards</hi> (a gesture of one praying), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 176</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:681" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 681</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:9" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:6:34" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 6, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 23, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:99" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 99</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornua aliis adunca, aliis redunca, supina, convexa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 45, § 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cathedra,</quote> <trans><tr>an easy chair with an inclined back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 37, 68, § 174</bibl></cit>: jactus, <hi rend="ital">a</hi> <pb n="1813" /> <cb n="SUPP" /> <hi rend="ital">throwing up</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:10:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 10, 13</bibl>: signis supinis, <hi rend="ital">lowered</hi> (opp. erectis), <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Sev. 7</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in arborum tonsurā supiniore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 23, 35, § 214</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46930.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n46930.4" n="1" level="3"> Of motion, <hi rend="ital">backwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">going back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retrograde</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">nec redit in fontes unda supina suos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,003:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Med. Fac. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursus fluminum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:5:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 5, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>that can be read backwards in the same metre</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:86:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 86, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46930.5" n="2" level="3"> Of localities. </sense><sense id="n46930.6" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Sloping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inclined</hi> (not in Cic.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. declivis): tabulae scheda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 12, 23, § 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scandenti circa ima labor est ... si haec jam lenius supina evaseris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:79" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per supinam vallem fusi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:46:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 46, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 24, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 24, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sin tumulis adclive solum collisque supinos (metabere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:276" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 276</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per supina camporum,</quote> <trans><tr>undulating</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 15, 7</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46930.7" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Stretched out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extended</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tibur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:30:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 30, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 2, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vindemia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 185</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n46930.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n46930.9" n="A" level="2"> Of the mind. </sense><sense id="n46930.10" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Careless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thoughtless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heedless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">negligent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indolent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">otiosi et supini (oratores),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 17</bibl></cit> Spald.: <cit><quote lang="la">supini securique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:1:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 1, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:17:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 17, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maecenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:66" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:42:22" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 42, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">compositio (with tarda),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:137" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignorantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:6:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 22, 6, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:79" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 79</bibl>. — <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deliciae supiniores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:6:13" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 6, 13</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46930.11" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">With head thrown back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">haughty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proud</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec et talia dum refert supinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:8:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 8, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:129" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 129</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46930.12" n="B" level="2"> In later gram. lang. <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpīnum</orth> (sc. verbum). </sense><sense id="n46930.13" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The verbal form in</hi> um <hi rend="ital">and</hi> u, <hi rend="ital">the supine</hi> (perh. because, although furnished with substantive case-endings, it rests or falls back on the verb), <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 153</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 811</bibl> ib. (called in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 29</bibl>, verba participialia).—</sense><sense id="n46930.14" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The verbal form in</hi> andum <hi rend="ital">and</hi> endum, <hi rend="ital">the gerund</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 153</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 823</bibl> ib. — Hence, * <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpīnē</orth> (acc. to II. A. 1.), <hi rend="ital">carelessly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">negligently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficium accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:24:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 24, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
supo: <entryFree id="n46931" type="main" key="su^po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpo</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĭpo</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">suppo</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46931.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to throw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throw about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scatter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">supat jacit, unde dissipat disicit et obsipat obicit, et insipat, hoc est inicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=311" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 311</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf.: supare significat jacere et disicere, id. s. v. prosapia, p. 225: obtorque prorim ac suppa tortas copulas, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 200, 33</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 180 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
suppactus: <entryFree id="n46932" type="main" key="suppactus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suppactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of suppingo.</entryFree>
suppaedagogus: <entryFree id="n46933" type="gloss" key="suppaeda^go_gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sup-paedăgōgus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subp-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46933.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an under-teacher</hi>, Inscr. <bibl default="NO"><author>Donat.</author> 311, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suppaetulus: <entryFree id="n46934" type="hapax" key="suppaetu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sup-paetŭlus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46934.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">squinting somewhat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having a little cast</hi> or <hi rend="ital">squint</hi>: oculi, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 456, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suppallidus: <entryFree id="n46935" type="main" key="suppalli^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sup-pallĭdus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46935.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat pale</hi>, <hi rend="ital">palish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:20:section=84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 20, § 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:4:section=23" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 4, § 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suppalpor: <entryFree id="n46936" type="main" key="suppalpor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sup-palpor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subp-</orth>), <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n46936.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to caress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fondle</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">wheedle a little</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">occepit ejus matri suppalparier Vino, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suppalpandi nescius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 1:84" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 1, 84</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suppar: <entryFree id="n46937" type="main" key="suppar"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sup-par</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subpar</orth>), <itype>păris</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46937.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nearly equal</hi> (rare but class.): huic aetati suppares Alcibiades, Critias, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:7:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 7, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:17:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aevum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">musicae suppari gressu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 183, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratres, nec similes ejus nec suppares,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 10, 9</bibl></cit>. — <cit><quote lang="la">In logic: propositiones suppares,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 3, p. 31 sq.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
supparasitor: <entryFree id="n46938" type="main" key="suppa^ra^si_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sup-părăsītor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subp-</orth>), <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n46938.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to flatter</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fawn a little</hi>, like a parasite (Plautin.): <cit><quote lang="la">amanti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi semper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 77</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
supparatura: <entryFree id="n46939" type="main" key="suppa^ra_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suppărātūra</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subp-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. supparo</etym>, <sense id="n46939.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a restoration</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">generis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 61</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
supparo: <entryFree id="n46940" type="hapax" key="suppa^ro1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sup-păro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subp-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>par</etym>, <sense id="n46940.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make somewhat like</hi> or <hi rend="ital">similar</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">formam lupae feminae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Valent. 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46941" type="main" key="suppa^ro2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sup-păro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subp-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46941.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adjust</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">exuvias capiti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cult. Fem. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labem corpori,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Anim. 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
supparum: <entryFree id="n46942" type="main" key="suppa^rum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suppărum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sĭpărium, sĭpărum</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sĭphărum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">suppărus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sĭ-phărus</orth>) <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Oscan; orig., perh., linen stuff in gen.; hence</etym>, <sense id="n46942.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A linen garment worn by women</hi>: indutui alterum, quod subtus, a quo subucula: alterum quod supra, a quo supparus: nisi id, quod item dicunt<cb n="SUPP" />  Osce, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=131" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 131</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">supparus vestimentum puellare lineum, quod et subucula, id est camisia, dicitur: Afranius: puella non sum, supparo si induta sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=311" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 311</bibl></cit> ib.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 540, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid istae, quae vesti quotannis nomina inveniunt nova ... Indusiatam, patagiatam ... Supparum aut subminiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suppura angusta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:364" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 364</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46942.1" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A linen garment worn by men</hi>: hic indutus supparum, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 540, 15</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 540, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46942.2" n="II" level="1"> = <foreign lang="greek">si/faros,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">a small sail on the foremast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a topsail</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">supparum appellant dolonem, velum minus in navi, ut acation majus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=340" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 340</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">pandens Suppara velorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:428" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 428</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:2:27" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 2, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 77:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 77, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 698" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Herc. Oet. 698</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 327 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Med. 327 al.</bibl> —Collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">sippărum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">sippărus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 77:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 77, 1</bibl> Haase.</sense></entryFree>
suppateo: <entryFree id="n46943" type="main" key="suppa^te^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sup-pătĕo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subp-</orth>), <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46943.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lie open beneath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spread out beneath</hi> (Appul.): <cit><quote lang="la">quae (fovea) fruticibus imis suppatet,</quote> <trans><tr>was spread over at the bottom</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 210, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campi suppatentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7</bibl></cit>, p. 198, 31.</sense></entryFree>
suppedaneum: <entryFree id="n46944" type="main" key="suppe^da_ne^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sup-pĕdānĕum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subp-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>pedaneus</etym>, <sense id="n46944.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a footstool</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">pedum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 12, 17</bibl></cit> (from Psa. 109, 1, where Vulg. has scabellum).</sense></entryFree>
suppeditatio: <entryFree id="n46945" type="hapax" key="suppe^di^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suppĕdĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>suppedito</etym>, <sense id="n46945.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a full supply</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abundance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exuberance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suppeditatio bonorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:40:111" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 40, 111</bibl></cit> Mos.</sense></entryFree>
suppedito: <entryFree id="n46946" type="main" key="suppe^di^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suppĕdĭto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subp-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n46946.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [perh. for suppetito, from suppeto]. </sense><sense id="n46946.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be fully supplied</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in abundance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be at hand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be in store</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde Flumina suppeditant?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 231</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis apparatus ornatusque dicendi facile suppeditat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:31:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 31, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">P. Cethegus, cui de re publicā satis suppeditabat oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:48:178" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 48, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undique mihi suppeditat quod pro M. Scauro dicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,029:23:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Scaur. 23, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">innumerabilitas suppeditat atomorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:39:109" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 39, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod multitudo suppeditabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoad tela suppeditarunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:25:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 25, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne chartam quidem tibi suppeditare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui (Torquato) si vita suppeditavisset,</quote> <trans><tr>if he had lived</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:70:245" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 70, 245</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">27, 105</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">32, 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 6, 15</bibl>; cf. suppeto, I.: nec consilium, nec oratio suppeditat, i e. <hi rend="ital">I have neither sentiments nor terms</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 27, 3</bibl>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">subj.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere suppeditat,</quote> <trans><tr>it is easy to say</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:731" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 731</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46946.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46946.3" n="1" level="3"> Like abundare, <hi rend="ital">to have in abundance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to abound</hi> or <hi rend="ital">be rich in</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">omissis his rebus omnibus, quibus nos suppeditamus, eget ille,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita gaudiis gaudium suppeditat,</quote> <trans><tr>is increased by other joys</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 5, 1, 3</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46946.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To be enough</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sufficient</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to suffice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parare ea, quae suppeditent et ad cultum et ad victum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:4:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pometinae manubiae, quae perducendo ad culmen operi destinatae erant, vix in fundamenta suppeditavere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:55:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 55, 7</bibl></cit>: labori suppeditare, <hi rend="ital">to be fit for</hi> or <hi rend="ital">equal to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be a match for</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 17</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut (Thais) tuo amori suppeditare possit sine sumpto suo,</quote> <trans><tr>devote herself to you</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 46</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46946.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to give</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furnish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">afford</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supply</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">procure in abundance</hi> (freq. in Cic.; syn.: praebeo, suggero, ministro). </sense><sense id="n46946.6" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxuriae sumptus suppeditare ut possies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 13, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tributo sumptus suppeditari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:48:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 48, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:27:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 27, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (fistulis) aqua suppeditabatur templis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 11, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">merces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:3:section=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 3, § 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 74</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">172: rem frumentariam alicui ex provinciis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res eas, quibus ager Campanus coleretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:32:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 32, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutum perfugium otio et tranquillum ad quietem locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:4:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa ad luxuriam invitamenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabulas poëtis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:24:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 24, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsis pecuniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:137" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suppeditabit nobis Atticus noster e thesauris suis quos et quantos viros!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:21:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 21, 67</bibl></cit>. —With an abstr. object: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquis deus suppeditans omnium rerum abundantiam et copiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:23:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 23, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratoribus et poëtis mirabilem copiam dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:18:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 18, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecepta nobis (patria),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">varietatem tibi in scribendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hortorum amoenitatem mihi (domus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:4:section=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 4, § 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut, quocumque haec (voluptas) loco suppeditetur, ibi beate queant vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:37:108" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 37, 108</bibl></cit>.— <cb n="SUPP" /> </sense><sense id="n46946.7" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ciceroni meo suppeditabis quantum videbitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 17, 5</bibl></cit>. — ( <foreign lang="greek">g</foreign> ) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui sumptibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut 5, 1, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod Ciceroni suppeditas, gratum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 20, 3</bibl></cit>. — ( <foreign lang="greek">d</foreign> ) <hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod res curae tibi est, ut ei (Ciceroni) suppeditetur ad usum et cultum copiose,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 11, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suppedo: <entryFree id="n46947" type="gloss" key="suppe_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sup-pēdo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subp-</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46947.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to break wind softly</hi>, cited ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suppernatus: <entryFree id="n46948" type="main" key="supperna_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sup-pernātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>perna</etym>, <sense id="n46948.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lamed in the hip</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suppernati dicuntur, quibus femina sunt succisa, in modum suillarum pernarum. Ennius in Annalibus: is pernas succidit iniquā superbiā Poeni. Et Catullus (17, 19) alnus suppernata securi,</quote> <trans><tr>cut down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=305" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 305</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. p. 304 ib.</sense></entryFree>
suppes: <entryFree id="n46949" type="main" key="suppe_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suppēs</orth>, <itype>pĕdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sub-pes</etym>, <sense id="n46949.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having feet turned under</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with twisted feet</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suppetiae: <entryFree id="n46950" type="main" key="suppe^ti^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sup-pĕtĭae</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subp-</orth>), <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>suppeto</etym>, <sense id="n46950.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which comes to aid one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assistance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succor</hi> (ante-class. and post-Aug.; used only in <case>nom.</case> and <hi rend="ital">acc.;</hi> syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">auxilium, subsidium): auxilia mihi et suppetiae sunt domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non metuo meae quin uxori latae suppetiae sient,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 5, 1, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 7, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscibus ad suppetias uti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 299, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suppetias ferre,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 4, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 184, 39</bibl>.—The <case>acc.</case> suppetias sometimes occurs with verbs of motion for ad suppetias (to go, come, send, etc.), <hi rend="ital">to</hi> any one's <hi rend="ital">assistance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nae tibi, suppetias tempore adveni modo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Men 5, 7, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venire, Auct. B. Afr. 5: proficisci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occurrere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 66</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">68: accurrere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 234</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suppetior: <entryFree id="n46951" type="main" key="suppe^ti^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suppĕtĭor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subp-</orth>), <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n46951.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [suppetiae], <hi rend="ital">to come to the aid of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to assist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succor</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">most freq. in App.): quod mihi suppetiatus es, gratissimum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miserrimo seni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 210, 32</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">suppetiatum decurrunt anxii,</quote> <trans><tr>run to aid</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 147, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proclamare suppetiatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1</bibl></cit>, p. 108, 30; 8, p. 209, 35.</sense></entryFree>
suppeto: <entryFree id="n46952" type="main" key="suppe^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sup-pĕto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subp-</orth>), <itype>īvi or ĭi, ītum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <sense id="n46952.0" n="I" level="1"> To go or come to one, i. e., </sense><sense id="n46952.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be at hand</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in store</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be present</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut mihi supersit, suppetat, superstitet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si cui haec suppetunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off 2, 8, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui res non suppetat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:35:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 35, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vererer, ne mihi crimina non suppeterent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:11:section=31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 11, § 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne pabuli quidem satis magna copia suppetebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">copia frumenti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum copiaeque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:26:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 26, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus rebus numquam tanta suppeteret victoriae fiducia, Auct. B. Afr. 31: ut mihi ad remunerandum nihil suppetat praeter voluntatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibuscumque vires suppetebant ad arma ferenda, praesto fuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 22, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 9, 6, § 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque quo manus porrigeret suppetebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nondum suppetente ad haurien, dum ultra justa vi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 9, 6, § 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si vita suppetet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:4:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 4, 11</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita longior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:56:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 56, 7</bibl></cit>: quoad vita suppetet, Auct. B. Afr. 92; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 24</bibl>.—With pers. subject: <cit><quote lang="la">deos oro, ut vitae tuae superstes suppetat (uxor),</quote> <trans><tr>that she may survive you</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec consilium sibi suppetere diceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:48:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 48, 13</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n46952.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be equal to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sufficient for; to suffice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to agree with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">correspond to</hi> any thing; <cit><quote lang="la">= sufficere: ut amori, ut ambitioni, ut cottidianis sumptibus copiae suppetant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:32:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 32, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauper enim non est, cui rerum suppetit usus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utinam quae dicis, dictis facta suppetant,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>I wish you may be as good as your word</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rudis lingua non suppetebat libertati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:56:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 56, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut plagae possint suppetere ipsae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1050" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1050</bibl></cit>. — <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with pers. subject: <cit><quote lang="la">novis ut usque suppetas doloribus,</quote> <trans><tr>you may be exposed to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:64" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 64</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46952.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To ask in place of another</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to personate another</hi> in asking: <cit><quote lang="la">si silignario quis dixerit, ut quisquis nomine ejus siliginem petisset, ei daret ... furti actionem adversus eum qui suppetet, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:2:52:section=11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 2, 52, § 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suppilo: <entryFree id="n46953" type="main" key="suppi_lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sup-pīlo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subp-</orth>), no <sense id="n46953.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>pilus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to steal underhand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to filch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pilfer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purloin;</hi> with pers. object, <hi rend="ital">to rob</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pluck</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fleece</hi> (ante-class.): suffuror <pb n="1814" /> <cb n="SUPP" /> suppilo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallam alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi aurum et pallam ex arcis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suppiles clam domi uxorem tuam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 4, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 38</bibl></cit>; Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 13, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:ib. 12:33" default="NO"><author>Caecil.</author> ib. 12, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suppingo: <entryFree id="n46954" type="main" key="suppingo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sup-pingo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subp-</orth>), no <sense id="n46954.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>pactum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>pango</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to fasten underneath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to clout</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulmentas soccis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calcar alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 1:62" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 1, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui auro habeat soccis suppactum solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crepidas aureis clavis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 14, § 50</bibl></cit> (dub.; al. suffigo).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46955" type="hapax" key="suppingo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sup-pingo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subp-</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46955.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to paint over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffuse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora ignito rubore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 1454</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suppinguis: <entryFree id="n46956" type="hapax" key="suppinguis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sup-pinguis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subp-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46956.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat fat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fatty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
supplantatio: <entryFree id="n46957" type="main" key="supplanta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">supplantātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>supplanto</etym>, <sense id="n46957.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hypocritical deceit</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:40:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 40, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. 11, 3</bibl>; Hilar. in Psa. 139, 5.</sense></entryFree>
supplantator: <entryFree id="n46958" type="main" key="supplanta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sup-plantātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subpl-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46958.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who trips up another</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s heels</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a supplanter</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 69, 6</bibl> (of Jacob); <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 60</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
supplanto: <entryFree id="n46959" type="main" key="supplanto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sup-planto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subpl-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>planta</etym>, <sense id="n46959.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to trip up one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s heels</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to throw down</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">u(poskeli/zw.</foreign> </sense><sense id="n46959.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplantare dictum est pedem supponere, Lucilius: supplantare aiunt Graeci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 36, 3</bibl></cit>: qui stadium currit, supplantare eum, quīcum certet nullo modo debet, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:10:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 10, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">athleta supplantatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 13:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 13, 2</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46959.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to throw down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throw to the ground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overthrow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 7:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vites in terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 23, 35, § 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulturas (vehemens aquae vis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 22</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: tenero supplantat verba palato, <hi rend="ital">trips up</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">distorts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">minces</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:35" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium,</quote> <trans><tr>to overturn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
supplaudo: <entryFree id="n46960" type="main" key="supplaudo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">supplaudo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subpl-</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. supplodo.</entryFree>
supplausio: <entryFree id="n46961" type="main" key="supplausi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">supplausĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subpl-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, v. supplosio.</entryFree>
supplementum: <entryFree id="n46962" type="main" key="supple_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">supplēmentum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subpl-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>suppleo</etym>, <sense id="n46962.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that with which any thing is made full</hi> or <hi rend="ital">whole; a filling up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supply</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supplement.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46962.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (so rare; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. only post-Aug.): ex geminis singula capita in supplementum gregis reservantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:6:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ullis juventutis supplementis frequentatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:13:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 13, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adjectum supplementum Campaniae coloniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:81:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 81, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quosdam bello captos in supplementum urbium dividit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:6:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 8, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">digitum torpentem cornei circuli supplemento scripturae admovere,</quote> <trans><tr>with the help</tr>, <tr>aid</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:80" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplementum operi postulabant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. p. 231, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sordentia supplementa et dapes gratuitas conquirere,</quote> <trans><tr>broken victuals</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4</bibl></cit>, p. 149, 5: <cit><quote lang="la">artis magicae,</quote> <trans><tr>apparatus</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2</bibl></cit>, p. 124, 16.—</sense><sense id="n46962.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">a making up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filling up</hi> a body of troops, <hi rend="ital">recruiting;</hi> concr., <hi rend="ital">supplies</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reinforcements</hi> (the class. signif. of the word): <cit><quote lang="la">supplementum legionibus scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:10:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 10, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones veteres supplemento explere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per causam supplementi ab exercitu discedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplementi nomine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in supplementum classis juventus armaque data,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:37:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 37, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servos ad suplpementum remigum dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:47:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 47, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in supplementum scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">distribuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:5:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites, qui in supplementum venerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:4:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 4, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suppleo: <entryFree id="n46963" type="main" key="supple^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sup-plĕo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subpl</orth>）<orth extent="full" lang="la">-</orth>, <itype>ēvi, ētum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46963.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fill up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make full</hi> or <hi rend="ital">whole</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make good</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to complete</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supply</hi> (class.; cf.: reficio, suppedito). </sense><sense id="n46963.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">fiscellam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 88, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum suppleri summa queatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1044" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1044</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bibliothecam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usum provinciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:5:section=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 5, § 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hirtius, qui Gallici belli novissimum librum supplevit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adjectoque cavae supplentur corpore rugae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:291" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 291</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera supplevit lacrimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:140" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 140</bibl></cit>: tu mihi da cives et inania moenia (i. e. urbem) supple, <hi rend="ital">fill up</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">people</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:628" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 628</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si fetura gregem suppleverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad supplenda exercitūs damna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">damna incendiorum multis,</quote> <trans><tr>to make good</tr>, <tr>repair</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">colos consumptas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1084" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1084</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aerarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut referendis praeteritis verbis id scriptum suppleatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:26:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 26, 110</bibl></cit>: hypocauston. si dies nubilus,<cb n="SUPP" />  immisso vapore solis vicem supplet, <hi rend="ital">supplies the place of</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 24</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">locum parentis tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hipp. 633" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hipp. 633</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remis Zephyros,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponite ante oculos M. Antonium consularem, sperantem consulatum Lucium adjungite: supplete ceteros, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemia,</quote> <trans><tr>to furnish</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 10, 412</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suppletis lucernis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>with oil</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 8, 43: <cit><quote lang="la">simili mixturā vas suppleatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:10:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 10, 2</bibl></cit>. — <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplet iste nescio qui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 17, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46963.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">to fill up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make complete</hi> or <hi rend="ital">full in number</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furnish with a complement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recruit</hi>: cum sex legionibus iisque suppletis ex Bruti exercitu, M. Anton. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 9, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:24:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 24, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum junioribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:11:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones subito delectu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decurias equitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves remigio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:39:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 39, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">remigium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:471" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 471</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suppletorium: <entryFree id="n46964" type="main" key="supple_to_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">supplētōrĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>suppleo</etym>, <sense id="n46964.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a supplement</hi> (late Lat.), Jul. ap. Aug. c. Sec. Resp. Jul. 5, 42.</sense></entryFree>
suppletus: <entryFree id="n46965" type="main" key="supple_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">supplētus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subpl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of suppleo.</entryFree>
supplex: <entryFree id="n46966" type="main" key="supplex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">supplex</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subpl-</orth>), <itype>ĭcis</itype> (<case>abl.</case> supplĭci, but also -ĭce freq. in dactyl. and anap. verse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 14, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:14" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:396 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 396 al.</bibl>; <sense id="n46966.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">and always when used subst.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:667" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 667</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 261</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:3:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 3, 14</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">or to denote a temporary attitude or relation, not a permanent characteristic,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,029:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Scaur. 2, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 287</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:346" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 346</bibl>; cf. Neue, Formenl. 2, 46; <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> supplicium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:16" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:34" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 34</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sup-plico, bending the knees, kneeling down; hence</etym>, <hi rend="ital">humbly begging</hi> or <hi rend="ital">entreating; humble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">submissive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beseeching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suppliant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supplicant</hi> (class.; syn.: humilis, submissus). </sense><sense id="n46966.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplex te ad pedes abiciebas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:34:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 34, 86</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 5, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad alios se reges supplicem contulisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et genua amplectens effatur talia supplex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:523" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 523</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vobis supplex manus tendit patria communis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 9, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">infra II.: se supplicem pro aliquo profiteri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:32:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 32, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplex ad aliquem venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 16</bibl></cit>, C, § <cit><quote lang="la">10: ad opem judicum supplices confugere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:15:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 15, 33</bibl></cit> (11, 23): <cit><quote lang="la">do manus Supplex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:2" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplex populi suffragia capto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi quo die Portus Alexandrea supplex patefecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:14:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 14, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplex rogabo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 50</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46966.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tibi fierem supplex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicibus supplex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:29:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 29, 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:53:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 53, 229</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego me plurimis pro te supplicem abjeci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:36:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 36, 100</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 2, 3, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 2, 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:6:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 6, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 8, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:185 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 185 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Alcibiades Socrati supplex esset, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:32:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 32, 77</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46966.3" n="(g)" level="5"> As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">supplex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a suppliant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">humble petitioner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in miseros ac supplices misericordiā uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et nos jacentis ad pedes supplicum voce prohibebis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu supplice digno dignior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:290" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 290</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paternus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 315" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 315</bibl></cit>; so with a <hi rend="ital">pron. possess.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vester est supplex, judices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:40:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 40, 86</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vester,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:70:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 70, 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:10:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 10, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplex vestrae misericordiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:32:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 32, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 4, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ages. 4, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tui numinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 343" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 343</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus inimicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 9:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 9, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46966.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things: <cit><quote lang="la">manus supplices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:21:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 21, 48</bibl></cit> (17, 38): <cit><quote lang="la">manu supplice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 279</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:11" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 14, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:439" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 439</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libelli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:31:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 31, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vota,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 32, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 31:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 31, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:396" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 396</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:6:28" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 6, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">voce supplex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oliva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:424" default="NO"><author>Val.
