id="n47068.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus, quae nec eripi nec surripi potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:3:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 6, 3, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut occulte surripi aut impune eripi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:4:section=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 4, § 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surripiendum aliquid putavi spatii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus quoque surpere debent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:314" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 314</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimina oculis patris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 11, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:2:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus quod adhuc subripiebatur, collige et serva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
surrogo: <entryFree id="n47069" type="main" key="surro^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sur-rŏgo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n47069.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a.;</hi> publicists' t. t. </sense><sense id="n47069.1" n="I" level="1"> Of the presider in the comitia, <hi rend="ital">to cause to be chosen in place of another</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to put in another</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to substitute</hi> (class.): cum eidem essent (decemviri) nec alios surrogare voluissent. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:37:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 37, 62</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 36, 61</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 31, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">collegam in locum Bruti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collegam sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetorem in locum alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:39:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 39, 7</bibl></cit>: <cb n="SURS" /> consules, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 24, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistratibus non surrogatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:3:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad magistratus subrogandos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 6, 6</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n47069.2" n="II" level="1"> Lex subrogatur, id est adicitur aliquid primae legi, Ulp. Reg. tit. 1, 3.</sense></entryFree>
surrostrani: <entryFree id="n47070" type="hapax" key="surrostra_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sur-rostrāni</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>rostrum</etym>, <sense id="n47070.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">people who hang about the forum near the rostra</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loungers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">idlers</hi>, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 1, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
surrotatus: <entryFree id="n47071" type="hapax" key="surro^ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sur-rŏtātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [roto], <sense id="n47071.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mounted on wheels</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aries,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 19 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
surrotundus: <entryFree id="n47072" type="hapax" key="surro^tundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sur-rŏtundus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n47072.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat round</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roundish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">radicula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
surrubeo: <entryFree id="n47073" type="main" key="surru^be^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sur-rŭbĕo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n47073.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be somewhat red</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reddish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to blush</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quale coloratum Tithoni conjuge caelum Subrubet, aut sponso visa puella novo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:5:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 5, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uva purpureo mero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:316" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 316</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grossi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 10, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
surruber: <entryFree id="n47074" type="hapax" key="surru^ber"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sur-rŭber</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <itype>bra, brum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n47074.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat red</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reddish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
surrubeus: <entryFree id="n47075" type="hapax" key="surru^be^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sur-rŭbĕus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n47075.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat red</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reddish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">color ostri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 549, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
surrubicundus: <entryFree id="n47076" type="main" key="surru^bi^cundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sur-rŭbĭcundus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n47076.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat red</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ruddy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reddish</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:4:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:20" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 26, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cauliculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 106, § 167</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
surrufus: <entryFree id="n47077" type="main" key="surru_fus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sur-rūfus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n47077.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat reddish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 61, § 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surrufus aliquantum,</quote> <trans><tr>red - haired</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 115</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
surrumo: <entryFree id="n47078" type="main" key="surru_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sur-rūmo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>rumis</etym>, <sense id="n47078.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to put to the udder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to let suck</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fetus ovium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:3:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agnos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:4:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 4, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. Fest. pp. 306 and 307.</sense></entryFree>
surrumpo: <entryFree id="n47079" type="hapax" key="surrumpo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sur-rumpo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n47079.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to break off below;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">to destroy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliorum surrumpant et labefaciant scita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 82</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
surrumus: <entryFree id="n47080" type="main" key="surru_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sur-rūmus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>rumis</etym>, <sense id="n47080.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">under the udder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sucking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suckling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:2:1:20" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> 2, 1, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:2:11:5" default="NO">2, 11, 5</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=270" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 270</bibl> Müll. et v. rumis.</sense></entryFree>
surruncivus: <entryFree id="n47081" type="main" key="surrunci_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sur-runcīvus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>runco</etym>, <sense id="n47081.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is grubbed up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">limites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Limit. p. 152" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Limit. p. 152</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:177" default="NO">177</bibl> and 209 Goes.</sense></entryFree>
surruo: <entryFree id="n47082" type="main" key="surru^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sur-rŭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <itype>ŭi, ŭtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n47082.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to tear down below</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to undermine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to dig under</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dig out; to break down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overthrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">demolish</hi>, etc. (class.; perh. not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n47082.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores a radicibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">robora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi ingentes speluncas surruit aetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:545" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 545</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">murum surruunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis simul locis aut surruti aut ariete decussi ruebant muri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 17, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia cuniculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 21, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muri partem ariete incusso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:46:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 46, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 11, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:29:6" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 29, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">muros (with perfringere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turrim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vallum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arces et stantia moenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:11:23" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 11, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arces mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:5" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 5</bibl></cit> (4, 4), 31: <cit><quote lang="la">claustra Pelusi Romano ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:9:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 9, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harena fluctibus subruta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 12</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">haerens Subruta fallaci servat vestigia limo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:475" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 475</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47082.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to undermine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subvert</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corrupt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis surruitur natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:866" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 866</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostram libertatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:23:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 23, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum laudis avarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos militum variis artibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aemulos Reges muneribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 16, 14</bibl></cit>: ne multorum securitas subruatur, Traj. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 111</bibl> (112).</sense></entryFree>
surrustice: <entryFree id="n47083" type="main" key="surrusti^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">surrustĭcē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. surrusticus <sense id="n47083.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
surrusticus: <entryFree id="n47084" type="main" key="surrusti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sur-rustĭcus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n47084.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat clownish</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rustic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonare subagreste quiddam planeque surrusticum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:74:259" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 74, 259</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:48:161" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 48, 161</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudor quidam paene surrusticus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 1</bibl></cit>.— * <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">surrustĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">somewhat clownishly</hi>, Gell. praef. § 10.</sense></entryFree>
surrutilo: <entryFree id="n47085" type="main" key="surru^ti^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sur-rŭtĭlo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n47085.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to glow slightly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to glimmer forth</hi> (late Lat.). </sense><sense id="n47085.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">jaspis surrutilans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 15, 54, 12</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47085.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">surrutilare tibi jam debet, quid sit anima,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. Anim. 1, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
surrutilus: <entryFree id="n47086" type="main" key="surru^ti^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sur-rŭtĭlus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n47086.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat reddish</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ruddy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 3, 3, § 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frutex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 11, 54, § 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aëtites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 21, 39, § 149</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
surrutus: <entryFree id="n47087" type="main" key="surru^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">surrŭtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of surruo.</entryFree>
sursum: <entryFree id="n47088" type="main" key="sursum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sursum</orth> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">sursus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 188</bibl>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">susum</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157, 15</bibl>; Aug. <cb n="SUSC" /> Tract. 8, Ep. 1, Joan. 2; Tract. 10, 5; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Mort. Pers. 19, 4</bibl>: <sense id="n47088.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">SVRVORSVM,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 204</bibl></cit>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>contr. from sub-vorsum</etym>, <hi rend="ital">from below</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on high</hi> (opp. deorsum; class. and very freq.). </sense><sense id="n47088.1" n="I" level="1"> Denoting motion: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ex alto puteo sursum ad summum escenderis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ascendere in tectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 4, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illuc,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid nunc supina sursum in caelum conspicis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subducere susum animam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">infra, II.: flammae expressae sursum (opp. deorsum ferri),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 204</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adspicit nil sursum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:97:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 97, 11</bibl></cit>: sursum ac deorsum diducere, Tubero ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7</bibl> (6), 4, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:105" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 105</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47088.2" n="b" level="4"> Pleon. joined with <hi rend="ital">versus</hi> (versum, vorsum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 123</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vineam sursum vorsum semper ducito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 33, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">32, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sursus enim vorsus gignuntur et augmina sumunt: Et sursum nitidae fruges arbustaque crescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum gradatim sursum versus reditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:39:135" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 39, 135</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sursum versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:7:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 7, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 24, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:32" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n47088.3" n="c" level="4"> Sursum deorsum, <hi rend="ital">up and down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to and fro</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sursum deorsum ultro citroque commeantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:33:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 33, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne sursum deorsum cursites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 47</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia ista sursum deorsum fortuna versavit,</quote> <trans><tr>topsy-turvy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 44:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 44, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod sursum est, deorsum faciunt,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>they turn every thing upside down</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 65 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n47088.4" n="II" level="1"> Denoting situation or locality, <hi rend="ital">high up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">above</hi> (very rare): qui colunt deorsum, magis aestate laborant; <cit><quote lang="la">qui sursum, magis hieme ... nec non sursum quam deorsum tardius seruntur ac metuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:6:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeterito hac rectā plateā sursum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nares, quod omnis odor ad supera fertur, recte sursum sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:56:141" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 56, 141</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
surus: <entryFree id="n47089" type="main" key="su_rus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47089.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a branch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a stake</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 10:section=73" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 10, § 73</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">surum dicebant, ex quo per deminutionem fit surculus. Ennius: unus surus surum ferret, tamen defendere possent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=299" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 299</bibl></cit> ib. (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:v. 516" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Ann. v. 516</bibl> Vahl.); cf. crebrisuro.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n47090" type="main" key="Surus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Surus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47090.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated elephant in the Carthaginian army</hi>, mentioned by <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, Plin. 8, 5, 5, § 12</bibl> (v. Syrus).</sense></entryFree>
sus: <entryFree id="n47091" type="main" key="su_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūs</orth>, <itype>sŭis</itype> (<case>nom.</case> suis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> adv. Symm. 2, 813</bibl>; <sense id="n47091.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> sueris, Plaut. ap. Fest. s. v. spectile, p. 330 Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=110" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 110</bibl> ib.; <hi rend="ital">dat. plur.</hi> subus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:969" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 969</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:974" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 974</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:977" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 977</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 23, § 75</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>), <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">u(=s;</foreign> O. H. Germ. sū; Engl. sow, swine</etym>. </sense><sense id="n47091.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A swine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hog</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pig</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferus et fera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 8:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:64:160" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 64, 160</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:13:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 13, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 17, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:414" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 414</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 75 al.</bibl>—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">sus Minervam (sc. docet) in proverbio est, ubi quis id docet alterum, cujus ipse inscius est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=310" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 310</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">etsi non sus Minervam, ut aiunt, tamen inepte, quisquis Minervam docet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etsi sus Minervam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">docebo sus, ut aiunt, oratorem eum, quem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:57:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 57, 233</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sus artium repertricem (docet),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 46, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47091.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of fish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:132" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 132</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
susa: <entryFree id="n47092" type="main" key="Su_sa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sūsa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sou=sa, ta/,</foreign> <sense id="n47092.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the ancient capital of Persia</hi>, now prob. <hi rend="ital">Soos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 27, 31, § 133</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 13</bibl> (3, 4), 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 7</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n47092.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sūsĭānē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the province of Susiana</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Susiane</hi>, in which Susa was situated, now <hi rend="ital">Khuzistan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 27, 31, § 133</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47092.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sūsĭāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Susa</hi> or <hi rend="ital">of Susiana</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 27, 31, § 133</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:3:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 3, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47092.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sūsis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Susa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Susian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Persian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora, Sid. poët. Ep. 7, 17: aula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:ib. 8:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suscenseo: <entryFree id="n47093" type="main" key="suscense^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suscensĕo</orth>, v. succenseo.</entryFree>
susceptio: <entryFree id="n47094" type="main" key="suscepti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">susceptĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>suscipio</etym>, <sense id="n47094.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a taking in hand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undertaking</hi> (good prose): <cit><quote lang="la">quae proficiscuntur a virtute, susceptione primā, non perfectione, recta sunt judicanda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:9:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 9, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laborum dolorumque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum istarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:3:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47094.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An acceptance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidelium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 6, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suscepto: <entryFree id="n47095" type="hapax" key="suscepto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suscepto</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47095.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to undertake</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 128, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
susceptor: <entryFree id="n47096" type="main" key="susceptor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">susceptor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym> (post-class.). <sense id="n47096.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who undertakes any thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an undertaker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contractor</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">conductor, redemptor): susceptores sollicitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:3:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 8, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: nemo militantium fiat susceptor defensorve causarum, Cod. Th. 2, 12, 6.—</sense><sense id="n47096.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A receiver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">collector</hi> of taxes, etc., Cod. Th. <pb n="1819" /> <cb n="SUSC" /> 12, tit. 6; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 10</bibl>, tit. 70; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 10, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47096.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who takes into his house</hi> or <hi rend="ital">harbors thieves</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gamesters</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">a receiver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gaming-house keeper</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:5:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 3, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47096.3" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A guardian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protector</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">41, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">90, 2 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
susceptum: <entryFree id="n47097" type="main" key="susceptum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">susceptum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. suscipio <sense id="n47097.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
susceptus: <entryFree id="n47098" type="main" key="susceptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">susceptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of suscipio.</entryFree>
suscipio: <entryFree id="n47099" type="main" key="susci^pi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suscĭpĭo</orth> (sometimes <orth extent="full" lang="la">succĭpĭo</orth>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 175</bibl> and 144; Vel. Long. p. 2226 P.), <itype>cēpi, ceptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>sus, a contraction of subs, for sub; v. sub <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>, and capio</etym>, qs. to take hold of in order to support, i. e. <sense id="n47099.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to take</hi> or <hi rend="ital">catch up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to take upon</hi> one. </sense><sense id="n47099.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To support</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sustain.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47099.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid loquar lapideas moles, quibus porticus suscipimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:26" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">theatrum fulturis ab substructionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:38:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 38, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latera puteorum structurā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Aug. 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labentem domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:15:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 15, 5</bibl></cit>: balnea suscepta crepidine, <hi rend="ital">supported</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resting on</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:3:43" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 3, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">habenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 728" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 728</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n47099.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n47099.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To support</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">famam defuncti pudoremque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui temere nocentis reos susciperet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:74" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum periculo suscepti litigatoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:12:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 12, 4</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47099.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To take upon</hi> one, <hi rend="ital">undertake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assume</hi>, <hi rend="ital">begin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incur</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enter upon</hi> (esp. when done voluntarily and as a favor; recipio, when done as a duty or under an obligation). </sense><sense id="n47099.6" n="(a)" level="5"> Of actions, obligations, etc. (class. and freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">aut inimicitias aut laborem aut sumptus suscipere nolunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:9:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 9, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimicitias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 1, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pelop. 1, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 21, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">personā susceptā viri boni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:36:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 36, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honestam rem actionemve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:13:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 13, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:14:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 14, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:23:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 23, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:11:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 11, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 37 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei publicae partem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:6:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 6, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:15:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 15, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:8:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 4, 8, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrocinium improbitatis, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:17:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 17, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter Asiaticum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia alter pro altero suscipiet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:22:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 22, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aes alienum amicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:16:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 16, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum inaudita ac nefaria sacra susceperis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: porcam praecidaneam, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 163, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulvinar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:52:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 52, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodigia (with curare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">votum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:45:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 45, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:246" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 246</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">disputationem de re publicā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:7:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 7, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 2, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec enim hoc suscepi, ut, etc., tamquam magister persequerer omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:24:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 24, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">permagnum quiddam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:22:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 22, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae si suscipiamus,</quote> <trans><tr>undertake to prove</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:40:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 40, 84</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui suscipiant, posse animum manere corpore vacantem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:32:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 32, 78</bibl></cit>.— Rarely with <hi rend="ital">dat. of reflex. pron.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legationem ad civitates sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum sibi auctoritatis in re publicā suscepit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:58:section=152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 58, § 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi auctoritatem patriam severitatemque suscipio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:16:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 16, 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47099.7" n="(b)" level="5"> Of feelings, experiences, etc., <hi rend="ital">to undergo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">submit to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accept</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbos durumque dolorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:460" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 460</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">dolorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:46:111" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 46, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolorem gemitumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiam atque offensionem apud populos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:55:section=137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 55, § 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molestiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 6, 17</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">miserius qui suscipit in se scelus quam si qui alterius facinus subire cogitur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>wilfully incurs guilt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si esset inventus, qui in se suscipere istius culpam crimenque cuperet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:42:section=91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 42, § 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotiatoribus Claudius certa lucra proposuit, suscepto in se damno, si cui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 18</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47099.8" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To take</hi>, <hi rend="ital">catch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">receive.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47099.9" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (so only <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">sol aeternam suscepit lampada mundi,</quote> <trans><tr>to catch up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:402" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 402</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dominam ruentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:806" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 806</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suscipiunt famulae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 391</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruorem pateris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 249</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cava suscepto flumine palma sat est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 9, 36 (al. succepto): <cit><quote lang="la">ignem foliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 175</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47099.10" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n47099.11" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To take up</hi> a new-born child from the ground; hence, <hi rend="ital">to acknowledge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recognize</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring up as one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s own</hi> (class.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">tollo): simul atque editi in lucem et suscepti sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ad te die natali meo scripsi, quo utinam susceptus non essem!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 9, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47099.12" n="b" level="4"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to get</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beget</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">bear</hi> children: <cit><quote lang="la">filia, quam ex te suscepi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: filiam ex <cb n="SUSI" /> uxore, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7</bibl> (8), 50: <cit><quote lang="la">liberos ex libertini filiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 6, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7</bibl> (8), 74: <cit><quote lang="la">inde filiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 8</bibl></cit> (9), 18: <cit><quote lang="la">susceperas liberos non solum tibi, sed etiam patriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:69:section=161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 69, § 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si qua mihi de te suscepta fuisset Ante fugam suboles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:327" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 327</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judic. 11, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47099.13" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To take</hi>, <hi rend="ital">receive</hi>, as a citizen, under one's protection, as a pupil, etc. (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Cato cum esset Tusculi natus, in populi Romani civitatem susceptus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: suscipe me totum, Vatin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 9, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suscepi candidatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">susceptos a se discipulos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:55" default="NO">11, 1, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pancratiasten docendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:8:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 8, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquos erudiendos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:8:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 8, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47099.14" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To receive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">get</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:3:25" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 22, 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pretio, quod dominus suscepit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 213, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47099.15" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">suscepit vita hominum consuetudoque communis, ut, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>has allowed</tr>, <tr>admitted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:24:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 24, 62</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47099.16" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To take up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resume</hi>, <hi rend="ital">continue</hi> a speech, <hi rend="ital">answer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suscipit Stolo: Tu, inquit, invides, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:24" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 24</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad quod ... sermonem suscipit Polus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:723" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 723</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 150, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9</bibl>, p. 227, 12. —Hence, <pos>P. a.</pos> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">susceptum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an undertaking</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">susceptaque magna labore Crescere difficili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 200</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suscitabulum: <entryFree id="n47100" type="hapax" key="susci^ta_bu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suscĭtābŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>suscito</etym>, <sense id="n47100.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stimulant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incitement</hi>: vocis, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 176, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suscitatio: <entryFree id="n47101" type="main" key="susci^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suscĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47101.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an awakening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resuscitation</hi> from death (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carn. Chr. 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> de Bono Mort. 4, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suscitator: <entryFree id="n47102" type="main" key="susci^ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suscĭtātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47102.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an awakener</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resuscitator</hi> (late Lat.). </sense><sense id="n47102.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Prax. 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n47102.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterarum quodammodo jam sepultarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suscito: <entryFree id="n47103" type="main" key="susci^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suscĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>sub-cito</etym>, <sense id="n47103.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lift up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elevate</hi> (syn.: erigo, elevo). </sense><sense id="n47103.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">terga (i. e. humum),</quote> <trans><tr>to throw up</tr>, <tr>cast up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undas (Nilus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 225</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aura lintea Suscitat,</quote> <trans><tr>swells</tr>, <tr>fills</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 5, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures,</quote> <trans><tr>to erect</tr>, <tr>prick up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:125" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulturium a cano capite,</quote> <trans><tr>to scare away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulverem pede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 3</bibl></cit>, ext. 3.—</sense><sense id="n47103.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n47103.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To build</hi>, <hi rend="ital">erect</hi> (ante- and postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">delubra deum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">basilicas et forum in tantam altitudinem, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eum.</author> Pan. ad Const. 22 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n47103.4" n="B" level="2"> Of persons sleeping, at rest, or quiet; of things at rest, etc., <hi rend="ital">to stir up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rouse up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arouse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">awaken; to set in motion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encourage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incite</hi> (the predom. signif. of the word; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. expergefacio): aliquem e somno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 19, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem e molli quiete,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:80:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 80, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae me somno suscitet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic deposuit caput et dormit: suscita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad suom officium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in arma viros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:463" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 463</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 618</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">te ab tuis subselliis contra te testem suscitabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 13, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tacentem musam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:10:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 10, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oscinem corvum prece suscitabo Solis ab ortu,</quote> <trans><tr>will invoke</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 27, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut te (aegrotum) Suscitet,</quote> <trans><tr>would restore</tr>, <tr>revive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 1, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortuos,</quote> <trans><tr>to awaken</tr>, <tr>resuscitate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. Verb. Dom. 44:2" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. Verb. Dom. 44, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:44:1" default="NO">44, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:44:3" default="NO">44, 3</bibl> sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">Cupido Suscitat affixam maestis Aeetida curis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:233" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 233</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vesbius attonitas acer cum suscitat urbes,</quote> <trans><tr>startles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:209" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si te suscitat Oceanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:9:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā te suscitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:95:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 95, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:36:5" default="NO">5, 36, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suscitatus,</quote> <trans><tr>raised from the dead</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. Verb. Dom. 44" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. Verb. Dom. 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47103.5" n="b" level="4"> Of things concr. or abstr.: <cit><quote lang="la">cinerem et sopitos suscitat ignes,</quote> <trans><tr>stirs up</tr>, <tr>rekindles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:743" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 743</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes hesternos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:642" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 642</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">exstinctos ignes (i. e. amoris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:597" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 597</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crepitum,</quote> <trans><tr>to raise</tr>, <tr>excite</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:4:14" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 5, 28</bibl></cit>: fictas sententias, <hi rend="ital">to bring forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invent</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:40:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 40, 88</bibl> (Trag. v. 447 Vahl.): bellum civile, Brut. et Cass. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vim suscitat ira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:454" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 454</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saevam caedem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 498</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensus tuos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 789" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 789</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne sopitam memoriam malorum oratio mea suscitet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nazar.</author> Pan. ad Const. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ensis ad tympana,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 2, 281</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
susiane: <entryFree id="n47104" type="main" key="Su_si^a_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sūsĭānē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, v. Susa, A.</entryFree>
susiani: <entryFree id="n47105" type="main" key="Su_si^a_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sūsĭāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. Susa, B.</entryFree>
susinatus: <entryFree id="n47106" type="main" key="su_si^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūsĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>susinus</etym>, <sense id="n47106.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">made from lilies</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
susinus: <entryFree id="n47107" type="greek" key="su_si^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūsĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">sou/sinos,</foreign> <sense id="n47107.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">made of lilies</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unguentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 1, 2, § 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 21, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
susis: <entryFree id="n47108" type="main" key="Su_sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sūsis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, v. Susa, C. <cb n="SUSP" /></entryFree>
suspectatio: <entryFree id="n47109" type="main" key="suspecta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suspectātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, v. 2. suspicio.</entryFree>
suspectio: <entryFree id="n47110" type="main" key="suspecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suspectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. suspicio</etym>, <sense id="n47110.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a looking up to</hi> any one; trop., <hi rend="ital">an esteeming highly</hi> (very rare), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, p. 221</bibl> (7, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> Orell.).</sense></entryFree>
suspecto: <entryFree id="n47111" type="main" key="suspecto1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suspecto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47111.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to look up at; to look up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to watch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">observe</hi>, etc. (ante-class. and postAug.). </sense><sense id="n47111.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulam pictam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 36</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">leo suspectans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 16, 21, § 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitis suspectantibus populis, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 29, 35, § 104</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47111.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to mistrust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suspect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apprehend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Agrippinam magis magisque suspectans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem prolationem, ut inimicam victoriae, suspectabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfidiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 27</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 11, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 292 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolum ab aliquo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Chron. 1, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspectante Nerone, haud falsa esse, quae vera non probabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 51</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne pellici suspectaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(vidua) jam ob unum divortium suspectanda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 332, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum externi motus suspectarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 4:2:9" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 4, 2, 9</bibl></cit>.?*! <hi rend="ital">Dep.</hi> collat. form (in analogy with suspicor): <cit><quote lang="la">hi, quos suspectati sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 1, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n47112" type="main" key="suspecto_2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suspectō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>suspectus</etym>, <sense id="n47112.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in a manner to excite suspicion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suspiciously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui mortem liberorum suspecto decedentium non defenderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:9:11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 9, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suspector: <entryFree id="n47113" type="main" key="suspector1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suspector</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, v. suspecto <sense id="n47113.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n47114" type="main" key="suspector2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suspector</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. suspicio</etym>, <sense id="n47114.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who looks up to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">respects</hi> a thing, <hi rend="ital">a respecter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">morum vestrorum suspector admiratorque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suspectus: <entryFree id="n47115" type="main" key="suspectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suspectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of 1. suspicio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n47116" type="main" key="suspectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suspectus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. suspicio</etym>, <sense id="n47116.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a looking up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upwards</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose). </sense><sense id="n47116.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">color nigricans aspectu idemque suspectu refulgens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 38, 62, § 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in suspectu esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 9, 40, § 123</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:45" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 8, 22, § 45</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47116.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf., <hi rend="ital">a height</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tartarus ipse Bis patet in praeceps tantum ... Quantus ad aetherium caeli suspectus Olympum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:579" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 579</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turris erat vasto suspectu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 530</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47116.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">high regard</hi> or <hi rend="ital">esteem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">respect</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">honorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:31" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimius sui suspectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:26" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facta ejus dictaque quanto meruit suspectu celebramus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 5:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 5, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7 praef.</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
suspendiosus: <entryFree id="n47117" type="main" key="suspendi^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suspendĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>suspendium</etym>, <sense id="n47117.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to hanging</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fames,</quote> <trans><tr>suffered while hanging</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 37, 56, § 134</bibl></cit> Jan.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">suspendĭōsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one that has hanged himself</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 12, 603</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 12, § 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:2:11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 2, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suspendium: <entryFree id="n47118" type="main" key="suspendi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suspendĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>suspendo</etym>, <sense id="n47118.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hanging of one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a hanging</hi> (class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 1, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">utinam me Divi adaxint ad suspendium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 1, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriae remedium morte ac suspendio quaerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:56:section=129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 56, § 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspendio vitam finire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:65" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspendio interemptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 1, 2, § 71</bibl></cit> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praebuit illa arbor misero suspendia collo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:12:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 12, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proscriptiones miserorumque suspendia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 11, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suspendo: <entryFree id="n47119" type="main" key="suspendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suspendo</orth>, <itype>di, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>sus, from subs, for sub; v. sub, III., and pendo</etym>, <sense id="n47119.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hang up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hang</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suspend</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n47119.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n47119.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">pernas suspendito in vento biduum ... suspendito in fumo biduum ... suspendito in carnario,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 162, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in fumo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 4, 11, § 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspensae in litore vestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:305" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 305</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">religata ad pinnam muri reste suspensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:16:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 16, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oscilla ex altā pinu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:389" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 389</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">columbam malo ab alto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:489" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 489</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tignis nidum suspendat hirundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:307" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 307</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habilem arcum umeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:318" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 318</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stamina telā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:576" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 576</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid collo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 40, § 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(ranae) suspensae pedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 8, 29, § 92</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:10:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 10, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid e collo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 7, 63, § 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">allium super prunas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 6, 34, § 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitem sub ramo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 23, 35, § 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cocleam in fumo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 4, 11, § 31</bibl></cit>: aliquid lance, <hi rend="ital">to weigh</hi>, Pert. 4, 10; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in trutinā Homerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:438" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 438</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspendi a jugulis suis gladios obsecrantes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 12, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se suspendit fenestrā,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to look out</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. p. 148, 6</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec sua credulitas piscem suspenderat hamo,</quote> <trans><tr>had hung</tr>, <tr>caught</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 101</bibl></cit>.—In a Greek construction: <pb n="1820" /> <cb n="SUSP" /> (pueri) laevo suspensi loculos tabulamque lacerto, <hi rend="ital">with their satchels hanging on their arms</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 74</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 56</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47119.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n47119.4" n="1" level="3"> Pregn., of persons. </sense><sense id="n47119.5" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To choke to death by hanging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hang</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">suffoco, strangulo): capias restim ac te suspendas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 184</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi me suspendo, occidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 5, 3</bibl></cit> 59: <cit><quote lang="la">se suspendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 135</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:56:section=129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 56, § 129</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:40:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 40, 1</bibl>: caput obnubito: arbori infelici suspendito, Lex. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 4, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 26, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxorem suam suspendisse se de ficu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:69:278" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 69, 278</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se e ficu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:88" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem in oleastro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:23:section=57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 23, § 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">more vel intereas capti suspensus Achaei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:297" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 297</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in furcā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:13:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 13, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">virgines, quae corporibus suspensis demortuae forent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:10:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 10, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47119.6" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To hang at the whipping-post; pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be flogged</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 7, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47119.7" n="2" level="3"> Of offerings in a temple, <hi rend="ital">to hang up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dedicate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consecrate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">votas vestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:769" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 769</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 408</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma capta patri Quirino,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 859</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestimenta maris deo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insignia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:4:23" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 4, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47119.8" n="3" level="3"> Esp., of buildings, <hi rend="ital">to build upon arches</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vaults</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to arch</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vault</hi>: primus balneola suspendit, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 194, 14</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 4, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavimenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cameras harundinibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to arch over</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 36, 64, § 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra saxis praeruptis,</quote> <trans><tr>to build on</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:556" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 556</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velabra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 6, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo tigna ... suspenderent eam contignationem,</quote> <trans><tr>propped up</tr>, <tr>supported</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
