C. 2, 9, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § 5.—</sense><sense id="n47119.9" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (with esp. reference to the thing beneath), <hi rend="ital">to prop up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">muro suspenso furculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agentem ex imo rimas insulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:15:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 15, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus ligneis columnis suspenditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 4, 21, § 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolia subjectis parvis tribus lapidibus suspenduntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:18:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 18, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:15:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 15, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13:8" default="NO">3, 13, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbis Libycos Indis dentibus,</quote> <trans><tr>tables with ivory feet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:43:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 43, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum terra levis virgultaque molem suspendant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:397" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 397</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 135</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pes summis digitis suspenditur,</quote> <trans><tr>is raised on tiptoe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:125" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 125</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47119.10" n="c" level="4"> Esp., of ploughing, etc., <hi rend="ital">to lift up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raise</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si non fuerit tellus fecunda ... tenui sat erit suspendere sulco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ripas ... litora multo vomere suspendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:181" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 181</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vineam in summā terrā suspendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47119.11" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>; <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> suspendi, <hi rend="ital">to depend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rest</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n47119.12" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">extrinsecus aut bene aut male vivendi suspensas habere rationes,</quote> <trans><tr>dependent upon externals</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui viro ex se ipso apta sunt omnia, nec suspensa aliorum aut bono casu aut contrario pendere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:12:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 12, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus, ex quo ceterae species suspensae sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 58:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 58, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam crediderim felicem ex felicitate suspensum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 98:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 98, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47119.13" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to cause to be suspended</hi>, i. e., </sense><sense id="n47119.14" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To make uncertain</hi> or <hi rend="ital">doubtful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to keep in suspense</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">medio responso rem suspenderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 29, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa Suspendit animos fictā gravitate rogantum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:308" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 308</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea res omnium animos exspectatione suspenderat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:7:20" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem exspectatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 20, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diu judicum animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">senatum ambiguis responsis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspensa ac velut dubitans oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exspectationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:4:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 4, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. infra, in the <pos>P. a.</pos> —</sense><sense id="n47119.15" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To stay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">check</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interrupt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suspend</hi> (syn. supprimo): <cit><quote lang="la">nec jam suspendere fletum Sustinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:849" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 849</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:7:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 7, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:35 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 35 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluxiones oculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 7, 21, § 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epiphoras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 12, 91, § 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causas morbi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 3, 65, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gressum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 55, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manum tuam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 40, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <pos>P. a.</pos> 2. infra. — * </sense><sense id="n47119.16" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To hang</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fix upon</hi> something: <cit><quote lang="la">suspendit pictā vultum mentemque tabellā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 97</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47119.17" n="4" level="3"> Aliquem or aliquid naso (adunco), <hi rend="ital">to turn up one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s nose at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sneer at</hi> a person or thing (Horatian): <cit><quote lang="la">naso suspendis adunco Ignotos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Balatro suspendens omnia naso,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 8, 64</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47119.18" n="5" level="3"> Of a temporary removal from office, <hi rend="ital">to suspend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">duobus hunc (episcopum) mensibus, Greg. M. Ep. 3, 46: ab officio suspensus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">suspen-sus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n47119.19" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug-prose). </sense><sense id="n47119.20" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Raised</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elerated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suspended</hi>: Roma cenaculis sublata atque<cb n="SUSP" />  suspensa, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:35:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 35, 96</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">saxis suspensam hanc aspice rupem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 190</bibl></cit>: equi illi Neptunii, qui per undas currus suspensos rapuisse dicuntur, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:27:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 27, 67</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vel mare per medium fluctu suspensa tumenti Ferret iter,</quote> <trans><tr>skimming lightly over the waters</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:810" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 810</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(corus) suspensum in terras portat mare,</quote> <trans><tr>raised on high</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:470" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 470</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspensis auribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:6" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 6</bibl></cit> (4, 5), 8: <cit><quote lang="la">aura suspensa levisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <trans><tr>loosened</tr>, <tr>loose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:54" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspensissimum pastinatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 13, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(oliva) inicitur quam mundissimis molis suspensis ne nucleus frangatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:51:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 51, 2</bibl></cit>, and 54, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">radix suspensa pariter et mersa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:20:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 20, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspensum inter nubila corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:94" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 94</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:470" default="NO">1, 470</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">loco ab umore suspenso,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 40, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alituum suspensa cohors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Phoen. 77" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Phoen. 77</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47119.21" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">suspended</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">pressing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">touching lightly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">light</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspenso gradu placide ire perrexi,</quote> <trans><tr>on tiptoe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:6:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 6, 28</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">gradu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:426" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 426</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 338</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">evagata noctu suspenso pede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1 praef" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1 praef.</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspensa levans digitis vestigia primis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestigia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:617" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 617</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspensā manu commendare aliquem,</quote> <trans><tr>slightly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspensis dentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1069" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1069</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspensis passibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molis suspensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:51:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 51, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:54:2" default="NO">12, 54, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47119.22" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n47119.23" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Uncertain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hovering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">doubtful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wavering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hesitating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in suspense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undetermined</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anxious</hi> (the predom. and class. signif.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: incertus, dubius): nolo suspensam et incertam plebem Romanam obscurā spe et caecā exspectatione pendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:25:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 25, 66</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas suspensa metu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspensum me tenes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maneo Thessalonicae suspensus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 8, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:43" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot populos inter spem metumque suspensos animi habetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspensus animus et sollicitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspenso animo exspectare, quod quis agat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 15, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:56:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 56, 239</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:6:section=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 6, § 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus suspensus curis majoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 7, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auditā inspectāque re, omnia suspensa neutro inclinatis sententiis reliquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:62:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 62, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimissis suspensā re legatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:32:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 32, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus suspensiore animo, Auct. B. Afr. 48, 3: suspensus incertusque vultus, coloris mutatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:19:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 19, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 8</bibl>; cf.: hominum exspectationem et spem rei publicae suspensam tenere, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 8, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspensam dubiamque noctem spe ac metu exegimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:20:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 20, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro homine amicissimo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 8:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munera suspensi plena timoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 84</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.: <cit><quote lang="la">suspensa et obscura verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 11</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Neutr. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quare non semper illam (nequitiam) in suspenso relinquam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 97:14" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 97, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est suspensum et anxium, de eo, quem ardentissime diligas, interdum nihil scire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem totam in suspenso reliqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 10:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 31</bibl></cit> (40), 4: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse in suspenso tenuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 78 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si adhuc in suspenso sit statuta libertas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:4:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 4, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:12:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 12, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47119.24" n="2" level="3"> Of goods held under a lien or judgment: <cit><quote lang="la">suspensis amici bonis libellum deicio creditoribus ejus me obligaturus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:12:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 12, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47119.25" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Dependent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui fideles nobis socii, qui dubii suspensaeque ex fortunā fidei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 18, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos ex tam levibus momentis fortunae suspensos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:32:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 32, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
